item.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Developer, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Calling all AI and machine learning experts! We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Software Developer to join our team.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our lab turns this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

As a tech pioneer within an AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems

  • Develop and deploy to production data and machine learning pipeline at scale

  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada

  • Explore new technologies and use them in your own solutions

  • Validate the analytical approach and project outputs of other team members

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design

  • Mentor and coach interns and other engineers to help us grow, as a team

All this plus great work-life balance!

  • A bachelor’s degree in a discipline such as computer science, software engineering, AI, or a related field. MSc is an asset

  • Significant experience of at least 5 years in software development

  • 3+ years of experience solving business problem using machine learning

  • Expertise in programming in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.

  • Expertise with the machine learning development lifecycle

  • Experience developing data and machine learning pipelines

  • Familiar with the underlying theory of machine learning (supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning)

  • Unlimited curiosity and the desire to challenge the status quo

  • You can take a vaguely defined issue and bring it to life using a creative approach

  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills

  • The passion for developing world-class data products

Some nice-to-haves:

  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, ELK;

  • Knowledge of our tech stack: xgboost, LightGBM, Flask, MongoDB, Kafka

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An extensive, flexible benefits package

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

#LI-Hybrid  #LI-IT  

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
 

If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. About the role

As a senior backend developer, you will play a crucial role in developing and improving our mobile ecosystem. Reporting to the Manager DevOps, Infra & Mobile Services , your main responsibilities are:

  • Conceive and build backend solutions for our mobile ecosystem.
  • Use best architecture practices and development patterns.
  • Ensure performance, quality and security.
  • Collaborate, in an agile context, with a multidisciplinary team throughout product design and development.

Qualifications

  • Good understanding of web & mobile technologies
  • Knowledges of Rest & micro services architecture. 
  • Familiar with Java/Kotlin, Docker/Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, Kafka, Spring Boot, and MongoDB / Oracle. 
  • Comfortable with AWS services such as S3, Lambda, SQS
  • Experience with asynchronous architecture
  • Familiar with agile Scrum development methodology.
  • Familiar with Git and Atlassian tools.
  • In-depth understanding of the entire development process (design, development and deployment)
  • Bachelor of Software Engineering or related discipline.
  • Up to 7 years of proven work experience

item.title: Senior Fullstack Web Developer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Role

Our teams design and develop new technologies and products that are changing the way thousands of people interact with insurance. We are looking for software developers who can bring innovative ideas in all areas (Web, Mobile, AI, CI / CD, microservices, Cloud Computing, DevOps).

You will work on a product intended to enhance the experiences of our users by offering essential self-service features through our Customer Center product.

Reporting to the Manager Software Development, your main responsibilities are:

  • Be part of a high-level multidisciplinary team.
  • Solve complex problems and challenges.
  • Help the team progress by participating in design, code and security reviews.
  • Participate in various Agile / Scrum meetings.
  • Results in a high-performance work environment that promotes autonomy and helps create a warm and friendly working atmosphere.

Qualifications:

  • A Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology / Software Engineering or any combination of training and equivalent experience.
  • 5 to 10 years of experience
  • Agile / Scrum mode and the DevOps spirit are no strangers to you

You are

  • Bilingual
  • Passionate about creating software products.
  • Stimulated by challenges.
  • Creative, curious and ingenious.
  • Team player ready to contribute and receive feedback.
  • Excellent popularizer able to explain his ideas to various stakeholders.
  • Organized, proactive and a driver of change.
  • Comfortable working in a constantly changing technological environment.

Our stack

  • Dev Web : React – JAVA – Kotlin – Spring Boot + Spring Cloud - MongoDB / Oracle 
  • Outils : Github – JIRA – Confluence – Teams - IntelliJ
  • CI/CD : Jenkins – Veracode – SonarQube – Twistlock
  • Hosting : Docker - Kubernetes – OpenShift – Elastic Search / Logstash / Kibana

item.title: Senior UX Designer - Intact lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We’re looking for a Senior UX Designer to join our growing team! 

As a UX Designer, you will bring a human-centered approach to our products and services. You\'re an expert facilitator, researcher, and strategist. Your quest is to demystify complex problems to conceive and help bring to life delightful digital experiences across both customer and employee journeys. 

As a member of our Enterprise UX team, you will be involved in the full co-creative design process: working with stakeholders from the earliest stages of discovery, using design-driven methods to shape the way we understand problems, develop insights, and deliver solutions. You will contribute to strategy and collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders to ensure organizational buy-in, alignment, and knowledge transfer - to elevate and transform our products and experiences. 

Workplace: Toronto (700, University Ave) or Montreal (2020, Robert- Bourassa Blvd). 

What you\'ll do here :

  • Inform our strategy and innovation efforts by providing insights into the needs of our customers and business - obtained through qualitative and quantitative research. 
  • Translate research insights into actionable design solution. 
  • Produce CX/UX artifacts such as wireframes, process and service blueprints and customer journeys to create a shared understanding of the experience across all lines of business. 
  • Undertake user research: client and stakeholder interviews, focus groups, usability tests, diary studies, etc. 
  • Contribute to a range of co-creation workshops to engage stakeholders and customers in designing customer-centric processes. 
  • Develop wireframes, visual elements, and reports to communicate ideas, secure stakeholder buy-in and inspire teams at all levels, from peers to executives. 
  • Develop working prototypes to test and validate solutions for refinement. 
  • Collaborate with product owners and business analysts to support the roll- out of initiatives through experimentation, testing and refinement based on learnings. 
  • Empathize with and lead stakeholders and customers as they move through the innovation journey. 

Everyone has a unique career journey and experience comes in many forms - this is considered a strength on our team. If you are unsure you meet all of the criteria but still feel this might be the right fit, please apply! We’d love to meet you rather than you self-select out of the process. Plus, we believe in hiring for potential, and proudly support training should you notice any skill gaps. 

What you bring to the table: 

  • At least 7 years of experience in service design, design strategy, experience design or user experience designer. 
  • Analytical, curious and creative. 
  • Proactive, comfortable working within a self-directed culture and navigating ambiguity. 
  • A patient listener, effective communicator, engaging presenter and compelling storyteller. 
  • Comfortable with interacting at different levels in the organization, from peers to senior management. 
  • Many examples in your back pocket that showcase your process in delivering user-centered design solutions. 
  • Experience in usability, user-centered design and design thinking practices. · Experience in facilitation, design research, and strategy. 
  • A team player who thrives in a collaborative environment and can provide and receive constructive feedback. 
  • Experience with design tools (Figma, Sketch, Axure, InVision, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.) 

Nice-to-have:

  • Strong visualization skills to communicate design ideas. 
  • Bilingualism (English/French) 

​Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#LI-Hybrid IN-QC

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.title: UX Designer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you\'ll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians.

The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you\'ll have access to all the tools you\'ve ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada\'s top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career.

About you
Are you passionate about digital innovation and Mobile experiences? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We\'ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

What you’ll do here:

As a UX Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital experience. Reporting to the Manager Design, Mobile Apps, your main responsibilities are:

  • Crafting human-centered experiences that help achieve business objectives.
  • Giving a voice to our customers by leveraging user-centric design practices.
  • Translate user needs and business requirements into engaging mobile features and functionality.
  • Assess and optimize feature performance with customers, analytics, and design research.
  • Work across cross-functional teams to design customer experiences and internal processes.
  • Create all assets to effectively conceptualize, communicate, and deliver the user-experience.

What you bring to the table:

  • At least 3 years of experience as a UX Designer or Lead UX Designer.
  • Strong capabilities in usability testing and user-centered design practices.
  • Capacity to understand business needs and to translate them into design requirements.
  • Mastery of design tools, especially Figma.
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • Experience in producing customer journey maps, process flows, content inventories, etc.
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

You are:

  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.
  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized, fully autonomous and proactive.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 
  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
  • An extensive, flexible benefits package
  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
  • A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office. 

#LI-Hybrid IN-QC

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

item.title: Senior AI Developer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Do you want to use AI to generate innovative solutions that bring clear tangible value to your organization?

Do you like building solutions in an agile environment? Do you want to have a strong impact on the AI and Machine Learning vision of Canada’s largest insurance company? We have the perfect opportunity for you!

What you’ll do here:

  • Participate in the design, development and evolution of microservices, APIs and reusable libraries for the execution of our algorithms in mission critical production environments.

  • Participate in the technological watch and definition of development standards to ensure system efficiency, resilience, and sustainability.

  • Keeping in mind long term target, lead and guide team of data scientists and AI developers to deliver best quality AI products which are easy to maintain and evolve.

  • Ensure development teams are using SE best practices.

  • Optimize the platform for maximum velocity and scalability.

  • Optimize and prioritize development tasks in collaboration with the team.

  • Help our testers in setting up component and integration tests.

  • Ensure the high level of quality of the work delivered.

  • Strengthen the development team productivity.

  • Oversee the development of appropriate tactics to achieve objectives.

  • Support and be proactively involved in problem situations or issues.

  • Play a Technical Leader / Mentor role for Squad members

What you bring to the table:

  • Bachelor’s in computer engineering, computer science or software engineering, with a minimum of 5 years of significant experience in development of enterprise grade software solutions

  • Proficient in python language and a good understanding of programming languages such as Java and Bash

  • Experienced with machine learning and data processing frameworks such as Spark/ Pyspark , XGBoost, Tensorflow.

  • Good understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithm design techniques

  • Experienced with machine learning libraries and scientific calculation such as Scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, etc.

  • Experienced with software engineering life cycle and agile methodologies.

  • Experienced in developing complex services based on Docker, Kubernetes, Flask and Spring Boot

  • Experienced with modern DevOps tools such as Gitlab, Grafana, ELK stack, Jenkins

  • Working knowledge of streaming and batch processing systems such as Kafka.

  • Familiarity with data storage and warehousing technologies such as Snowflake, MongoDB, S3.

  • Familiarity with AWS technologies such as Kinesis, Lambda and CloudWatch is a plus.

You are

  • Interested in Artificial Intelligence, able to interact with software engineers, data scientists and R&D teams.

  • Fast learner. We’re looking for team members who thrive on applying their knowledge, learning new technologies. You should be able to adapt easily to meet the rapid pace of a rapidly evolving research, development, and testing environment.

  • Versatility. In addition to having a good knowledge of the software engineering fields, you understand how all the pieces fit together into integrated systems, and how they meet business requirements. Very good communicator.

  • Passion. You feel ownership over everything you ship. You pride yourself on efficient monitoring, strong documentation, and proper test coverage. A mobilizer and delivery oriented.

  • A team player. You believe that the whole is greater than the sum of its parts. You rely on others\' candid feedback for continuous improvement.

Internal Candidates

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success

item.title: Senior AI Developer, Intact lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Your mission within our Innovation Lab :

  • Participate in the design, development and evolution of microservices, APIs and reusable libraries for the execution of our algorithms in mission critical production environments.

  • Participate in the technological watch and definition of development standards to ensure system efficiency, resilience, and sustainability.

  • Optimize the platform for maximum velocity and scalability.

  • Optimize and prioritize development tasks in collaboration with the team.

  • Help our testers in setting up component and integration tests.

  • Ensure the high level of quality of the work delivered.

  • Strengthen the development team productivity.

  • Oversee the development of appropriate tactics to achieve objectives.

  • Support and be proactively involved in problem situations or issues.

  • Play a Technical Leader / Mentor role for Squad members.

What you bring to the table :

  • Bachelor’s in computer engineering, computer science or software engineering, with a minimum of 5 years of significant experience in development of enterprise grade software solutions

  • Proficient in python language and a good understanding of programming languages such as Java and Bash

  • Good understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithm design techniques 

  • Experienced with machine learning libraries and scientific calculation such as Scikit-learn, NumPy, SciPy, etc.

  • Experienced with software engineering life cycle and agile methodologies.

  • Experienced in developing complex services based on Docker, Kubernetes, Flask and Spring Boot

  • Experienced with modern DevOps tools such as Gitlab, Grafana, ELK stack, Jenkins

  • Working knowledge of streaming and batch processing systems such as Kafka.

  • Familiarity with machine learning and data processing frameworks such as XGBoost, Tensorflow or Spark.

  • Familiarity with data storage and warehousing technologies such as Snowflake, MongoDB, S3.

  • Familiarity with AWS technologies such as Kinesis, Lambda and CloudWatch is a plus.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team : 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

item.title: Manager, Rapid Prototyping and UX Development, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

About you:

Do you like working with cutting edge technology to find solutions or opportunities that push up the innovation curve? Do you enjoy a fast-paced environment that allows you to experiment and fail fast? Are you a proven people and project leader with a highly collaborative spirit? Do you thrive in facilitating creative innovation within large organizations? Do you think that leveraging a Design System is the perfect way to accelerate software development and increase accessibility? We’ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

Role:

As a Manager, Rapid Prototyping and UX Development, you will lead an innovation practice by finding and testing new ideas and quickly designing, developing and testing functional prototypes. You will also lead a team of web and mobile developers that nourish the Design System to accelerate the work of other developers across the company. You’ll help teams develop relevant new skills and help influence long-term roadmaps. 

Your main responsibilities are:

  • Manage, mentor and inspire a team of web and mobile developers as well as multidisciplinary, rotating teams.
  • Define and put in place the development strategy for the Design System. Educate and influence partners and boost adoption of the Design system.
  • Organize and facilitate cross-functional research and ideation activities throughout the company.
  • Work with management stakeholders to identify the most promising ideas and ensure their buy-in.
  • Work with managers to equip the Rapid Prototyping team with temporary talent through rotation.
  • Design and build functional prototypes ready to go into production as pilot, measuring impact and communicating their performance.
  • Manage the deployment and operationalization of prototypes with business partners such as development teams, marketing, legal services, security, procurement, operations and others.
  • Coach and develop new skills within a multidisciplinary team made up of product, design and insurance specialists.
  • Work with external vendors, start-ups and our nationwide brokerage community to identify opportunities for collaboration.
  • Draw, plan and execute roadmaps.
  • Cultivate relationships with leadership that facilitate achieving customer-centric outcomes.

What you bring to the table:

  • Graduate studies in a design, engineering and software development related discipline.
  • Experience with integrating an innovation culture or experience implementing cutting-edge technologies. 
  • Hands-on experience on product development.
  • Experience managing a team.
  • Curious, bold, empathic, and strategic mindset.
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills in both English and French.
  • Demonstrated initiative, negotiating and coaching skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Strong customer service focus.
  • You enjoy working in an inspiring and creative environment and having fun!

#LI-IT   #LI-Hybrid

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. item.title: Instructional Designer
item.description:
Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

‍
‍DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the Director of Product Management, the Instructional Designer’s role is to own the customer education efforts for our Industrial AI. In collaboration with our internal subject matter experts, you will create engaging multi-media educational experiences for our clients within our self-paced online learning portal and track their effectiveness. The role includes collaborating with Marketing, Product Management, and Customer Success personnel to develop quality online material that supports active learning of the Canvass AI Platform.

‍

MAKE AN IMPACT!
  • Scope, design and develop course content, provide eLearning guidance, and liaison with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to develop customer education programs, presentations, and facilitation guides
  • Ensure all e-Learning materials meet company standards and learner needs
  • Develop and prepare course materials; prepare content briefs and edit content written by subject matter experts, direct and edit videos and voice overs, create branching scenarios, storyboards and scripts
  • Manage our Docebo Learning Management System (LMS) and establish design standards, completion records and reporting
  • Define and implement success measures for the Canvass AI customer education program
  • Create and manage reporting mechanisms to track compliance, learning objectives and key metrics
  • Work with relevant team members to create onboarding courses and learning journeys for new team members and customers, as required
  • Support Product, Customer Success, Sales teams to drive customer education efforts, as needed
  • Collaborate with the Product team to enhance user guidance across the Canvass platform

Your key deliverables are as follows:

1.  By Month 3,
‍

Content Development

a.  Use pre-identified learning paths to create customer education courses for prioritized product features

b.  Create a backlog of any unaddressed product features where content may be nice-to-have

c.  Support the development of user guidance across the Canvass AI platform

‍

LMS Implementation and Management

a.  Launch Canvass AI Academy 2.0 using Docebo LMS

b.  Identify opportunities to connect Canvass AI Academy to Canvass AI platform for a cohesive user experience

c.   Create an evaluation metric to support customer education efforts

2.  By Month 6,

‍

Content Development

a.  Identify new learning paths, wherever necessary

b.  With key stakeholders, identify prioritized content needed for the learning personas

c.  Support the development of user guidance across the Canvass AI platform

‍

LMS Management

a.  Evaluate the success of courses developed to support customer education efforts

b.  Evaluate if learning paths or personas need to be refined for a closer fit with product goals and market needs

‍

3.  Ongoing,

a.  With key stakeholders, create content for newly developed features

b.  Support the development of user guidance across the Canvass platform

c.  LMS Management

d.  Feedback tracking

‍

HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

Required:

  • Adult Education/ Instructional Design/ Instructional Technology, Learning Design, Learning Development certification, diploma or degree
  • 2 - 4 years’ work experience in curriculum development/ online course development for customer education
  • Experience with LMS (Docebo) Administration is preferred
  • Hands-on experience with a variety of eLearning authoring tools, such as Rise360, Lectora Online, Gomo, Vyond, EasyGenerator, Captivate
  • Possess a strong portfolio of e-learning and/or video work with instructional design examples that showcase strength in visual and graphic design (please be prepared to share)
  • Strong data literacy and a track record of using data and experimentation to drive decisions
  • Inspired and skilled to lead with autonomy and create compelling content.
  • Skilled at delivering high quality work, in a fast-paced start-up atmosphere
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including training content development and presentations
  • Strong interpersonal skills, capable of forming successful relationships and collaborating with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Demonstrated success in managing multiple projects and competing priorities
  • Proactive thinking, constantly seeking improvement opportunities in work and the ability to simplify complex information
  • Excellent listening and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail and organizational skills
  • Thrives in a fast-paced environment with constant change and a rapidly growing team

Preferred:

  • SCORM/AICC/xAPI experience
  • B2B SaaS Company experience
  • Start-up experience
  • Agile software environment

‍

WHY YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM!

Canvass AI is a leader in industrial AI. Canvass is innovating the way and empowering the industrial workforce to use AI in day-to-day operations. Our work has been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Start-up and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

​Canvass AI is a place where being formidable, innovative, and impactful is part of our DNA.  We have an inclusive culture that thrives on the challenges and opportunities that being a disruptor brings. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes, and accountable for it.  We are a flat organization to which you will be invited (and expected!) to be part of the conversation!

Don’t take our word for it – see why our team love to work at Canvass.

https://www.canvass.io/careers

‍

WHAT YOU GET…  YES, THERE’S MORE!
  • Part of Canvass’s Success Story Stock options to make you an owner in the company
  • Learning and Development: Free Coursera account to advance your skills and interests
  • Fostering innovation: Hackathons to showcase your ideas and skills
  • Inspiring positive impact: Guest speakers to inspire our mission and the impact it has on the world around us
  • Rewarding high performance: Quarterly and annual All Stars recognition program
  • Social and supportive team environment: Active social committee to help you meet team members; employee off-site events
  • Focus on health and wellness: Generous vacation and health benefits, annual wellness gift
  • Technology: Whether you’re working from the office or remotely, you’ll have access to the right tech and tools to set you up for success.

‍

READY TO WORK?

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit a formal application through our website Careers (canvass.io).

We love connecting with candidates who want to know more - find our staff on LinkedIn and get connected today!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/canvassai

Canvass AI supports an inclusive safe working environment and welcomes and encourages applications from all people. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Please include your request for any specific accommodations in your covering letter.

item.description:
Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

You will contribute to the overall success of Canvass AI business goals and be the voice of the company by ultimately ensure quality and informative content. As part of your role, you will develop compelling content, drive brand awareness, fuel customer, revenue growth, and grow our business globally.

Location: Hybrid remote in Toronto, Ontario

‍

MAKE AN IMPACT!

We are looking for a driven and motivated Content Manager to join our rapidly growing team. If you love to create and implement an engaging content, learning new topics in tech and never want two days to be the same – then this may be just the opportunity you are looking for. This is a full-time position based in Toronto, ON

  • Create content that is compelling on deadline for our target audiences, including editorial, thought leadership, white papers, videos, blogs, podcasts, event presentations, and social media engagement.
  • Writing long and short form copy for a wide range of communications: websites, email marketing and social media campaigns, blogs, newsletter stories, reports, and so much more.

  • Excellent organization, communication, writing and presentation skills with acute attention to detail.
  • Highly collaborative with experience working cross functionally across multiple levels, regions, functions, and regions.
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to discern priorities when multiple projects are moving forward simultaneously

‍

From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes and accountability for it.  We are a flat organization where you will be invited (and expected!) to be part of the conversation!
