item.title: Sales Account Executive
item.description:
Canvass AI - Industrial AI Built for Industrial Engineers

At Canvass, we are disrupting the way industrial operational data is being used to make critical business decisions. Our disruptive, leading edge AI-powered platform, transforms plant operations, giving  predictive insights that enable autonomous operations.

Canvass AI software platform is empowering industrial companies to transform industrial engineers into digital engineers who are driving data driven decisions in day to day operations. Canvass customers include leading energy, manufacturing, and mining companies around the globe.

We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

What You’ll Do

Canvass AI is seeking an Account Executive, a true hunter who wants to join our team and expand the business globally. This is an individual contributor position, newly added for business expansion.  

  • You will be identifying, negotiating and closing big deals in industrial market.  You will be comfortable presenting Canvass’s value proposition and business case to the C-Executive Suite as well as the technical users.  
  • You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and champions of the prospective deal.  
  • You will listen, identify and understand customer  needs and deliver to their expectations. You will be able to build relationships with multiple stakeholders and influence them in a positive way.  
  • You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking and utilizing business referrals.
  • You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.   Keep learning AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.  
  • You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  AND, we are led by character.
Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified

  • You are one to the top 10% of the sales people in your current company/division.  You are able to teach, tailor and take control of the sales cycle in a professional way. You are someone who pursues your passions with energy and commitment. We never, ever give up.
  • Fast learner; You are incredibly fast learner (we are in a market ready to change very fast and you have to be nimble of mind to keep up).  You have the intelligence to evolve to customer pain and map to customer personas and use cases. You will quickly learn our product, competition, processes, methodologies and how to build business cases mapped to successful business outcomes.  
  • Persistence, Heart and Desire. You will actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities through active networking, partners and utilizing business referrals. You will be called upon to utilize superior salesmanship to develop sales opportunities and identify the necessary decision makers and influencers of the prospective deal.  get a thrill from pursuing the close which also means you are calm under pressure and can make sound decisions quickly. The confidence in our product and our company just makes it easier for you.
  • Coachability and Adaptability: You believe in following a process because it works and changing it up when it doesn’t. You want to contribute to building tactics and refining our processes for repeatable success. Being familiar with MEDDICC and Challenger Sales is a plus.
  • ‍Integrity: You will seek feedback at every opportunity so you can be the best you can be.  You will seek this from leaders, peers and clients. We do the right thing always and take extreme pride in who we are, what we build and what we do.  
  • ‍‍Curiosity: You are hugely curious will constantly look for ways to enhance your knowledge of our industry, market, and competitors to provide that sales edge needed to close business and generate revenue.  You will keep asking the customer questions and gain validation of what you heard throughout the customer journey. Keep learning. AND be curious: we are constantly looking for ways to enhance knowledge of our industry, market and competitors to provide the sales edge to close business and generate revenue.
  • You love the Digital Transformation Revolution You understand challenging the status quo will provide positive business impact to all functions of an organization is critical.
  • 5+ years success in industrial or enterprise software sales or business technology products and services.
  • Experience with and understanding of AI and Machine Learning is highly favorable.
  • Exemplary written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal, planning, and organizational skills.
  • "Data" experience – big data, analytics, data science, machine learning, data integration
  • Experience with selling within Industrial Manufacturing is a plus.
  • Background in selling innovation and new concepts to large Enterprises
  • Ability to travel 10 to 40%
  • Software scale up experience is a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree required

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and recognition as you close new accounts. With a shorter-than-usual sales cycle for enterprise, you will reap the rewards of your efforts with uncapped commission and great incentive targets.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Equity Plan

‍Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Ventures.

What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture.

‍

item.title: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

Things you should know about our tech:
  • ‍We use a microservices architecture built predominantly with Python
  • Our single-page web application is built with React and we use Django for our RESTful API layer
  • We use Kubernetes to manage our cloud deployments in Azure
  • We’ve built a data pipeline with Kafka and use Kubeflow to orchestrate our machine learning pipeline
  • We use CircleCI to continuously integrate and deploy code changes

‍What we’re looking for:

We’re looking for candidates with:

  • Experience building web applications with Python, bonus points for experience with a RESTful API framework
  • Experience using React (or other JavaScript frameworks) to build complex web applications
  • An understanding of microservice architecture and distributed system design
  • Proven track record of delivering well-designed and tested software
  • Solid understanding of relational and non-relational databases and best practices

In general, we’re looking for a senior developer that exemplify these qualities:

Activation & Engagement Our developers are critical to the progress of our application and our business. We expect our developers to maintain focus on the business impact of their changes and advocate for work that will drive outcomes instead of just output.

‍Teamwork & Collaboration Our teams are small and extremely collaborative. Developers work very closely with a small number of other developers, a designer, and a product manager to meaningfully impact the business every week.

‍Excellence & Craft Software development is more than checking features off a list of requirements. We need our developers to build systems that are accessible to new teammates and extensible so that they can evolve with our business. We want our developers to take pride in what they build.

‍Communication & Leadership A developer can have a large impact by helping to grow the abilities and understanding of their teammates. We’re looking for people who can deliver learning sessions to introduce their technical teammates to new concepts and who can explain and contextualize their work to teammates outside of engineering.

What’s in it for you

You want to join a company that’s at the forefront of leading edge technology and you want to be the person that takes us there and captures massive market share. You want to be part of an ambitious, successful team that is rapidly scaling up, that gives you room to grow and build your career as the company grows.  

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • An incredible team with Inclusive culture, open to ideas
  • You build the future of the planet. An opportunity to work in a leading edge AI company that is making the planet safer and greener for the future.  
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with option to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Equity Plan
What\'s it like working at Canvass

This is a place where everyone is all in. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions. We have an inclusive culture and we are driven by the passion to make an impact to the future of the industrial sector which in turn impacts the climate sustainability.

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
‍

Canvass AI – Disrupting how Industrials Improve Global Productivity and Sustainability

Do you want to make a positive impact on the world?

Canvass AI is disrupting the manufacturing and industrial sector by making the hype of AI a reality. Our AI platform is fast becoming the most in-demand solution on the market because we put the power of AI in the hands of industrial engineers, who can now unleash the value in their data in ways they’ve never been able to before! We are helping the world’s largest companies drive impactful results, almost instantly, from improving their productivity to spearheading their global sustainability efforts. Our software and customer deployments prove each day that AI is revolutionizing how manufacturers reduce carbon emissions, waste, water, and energy consumption.

Proudly funded by Alphabet’s Gradient Ventures and Yamaha Motor Ventures. Join us on the quest to build a more sustainable and productive future!

DO WHAT YOU LOVE!

Reporting to the Director of Product Management, the Product Manager’s role is to define where our Industrial AI platform needs to go by creating a roadmap about what needs to get built and communicating those needs to our engineering team.  The Product Manager will be responsible for full life cycle product management and overall positioning of the platform for commercial success including supporting the sales team and marketing team with their efforts.

‍

MAKE AN IMPACT!
  1. Support Canvass AI’s overall growth strategy in terms of securing more customers and greater revenue by creating and defining the future direction for our Industrial AI platform including plans, tangible visions, and roadmaps to get there. Additional responsibility includes ensuring full adoption and usage of the Canvass platform, post purchase.
  2. Lead the development of future releases of the platform by working with product designers and software engineers. Specifically, the product manager will be responsible for defining the specifications of new capabilities to be built, ensuring those specifications are communicated to and understood by product designers and software engineers, and guiding the software development process.
  3. Become and be recognized as an internal expert on the Canvass AI platform.  Demonstrate leadership by providing training and information on specific products such as: “how to talk about the product”, “how to position the product” and be able to demo the product and share information about its application and use in industry in easy-to-understand terms.

‍HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?

  • 3 – 5 years work experience in an industrial engineering setting, with a preference for process industries (vs discrete)
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or a technology related field
  • Deep knowledge of Operational Technology (Plant floor systems and technology)
  • Experience working with industrial data (e.g., Data Historians such as OSIsoft PI System, AspenTech IP.21)
  • OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness) understanding and demonstrated use.
  • Ability to identify customer/user problems and define software solutions to address them
  • Excellent communication skills, able to work equally well with our customers, developers and internal stakeholders such as Marketing and Customer Success
  • A curious nature to think outside the box and a love to experiment.    
  • Collaboration skills and the knowledge that success as a product manager is rooted in ensuring the whole team is aligned and working together toward the same goal
  • [Nice to have] B2B SaaS Company experience
  • [Nice to have] Agile software environment
  • [Nice to have] Strong data literacy and a track record of using data and experimentation to drive product decision
  • [Bonus] Having built AI and machine learning models to solve industrial problems
  • [Bonus] Preferably you’ve worked in a startup before and understand life in a startup
  • [Bonus] Experience using Pendo

‍

WHY YOU WANT TO BE PART OF OUR TEAM!

Canvass AI is a leader in industrial AI. Canvass is innovating the way and empowering the industrial workforce to use AI in day to day operations. Our work has been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Start-up and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. We’re an agile scale-up with the operational intelligence of a global business. As we accelerate rapidly, we are constantly looking for driven and ambitious innovators to join our team.

​Canvass is a place where being formidable, innovative, and impactful is part of our DNA.  We have an inclusive culture that thrives on the challenges and opportunities that being a disruptor brings. From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes and accountability for it.  We are a flat organization where you will be invited (and expected!) to be part of the conversation!

Don’t take our word for it – see why our team love to work at Canvass.

https://www.canvass.io/careers

‍

WHAT YOU GET…  YES, THERE’S MORE!
  • Part of Canvass’s Success Story Stock options to make you an owner in the company
  • Learning and Development: Free Coursera account to advance your skills and interests
  • Fostering innovation: Hackathons to showcase your ideas and skills
  • Inspiring positive impact: Guest speakers to inspire our mission and the impact it has on the world around us
  • Rewarding high performance: Quarterly and annual All Stars recognition program
  • Social and supportive team environment: Active social committee to help you meet team members; employee off-site events
  • Focus on health and wellness: Generous vacation and health benefits, annual wellness gift we cover 100 percent of the premiums
  • Technology: Whether you’re working from the office or remotely, you’ll have access to the right tech and tools to set you up for success

‍

READY TO WORK?

Interested applicants are encouraged to submit a formal application through our website Careers (canvass.io).

We love connecting with candidates who want to know more - find our staff on LinkedIn and get connected today!

https://www.linkedin.com/company/canvassai

Canvass AI supports an inclusive safe working environment and welcomes and encourages applications from all people. Accommodations are available by request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  Please include your request for any specific accommodations in your covering letter.

item.title: Product Marketing - Industry Lead
item.description:
A Leader in Automating Intelligent Industrial Operations

Canvass AI is disrupting the industrial sector with its cutting-edge AI platform, by transforming industrial engineers into data and digital engineers. Backed by some of the world’s largest companies like Google’s Gradient Ventures, Canvass is democratizing the use of AI in day to day operations so industrial companies can build AI/ML models at scale and deploy them in production to gain business benefits in real time.

​Job Description

Reporting to the VP of Marketing, you live and breathe product marketing and know the immense value this strategic function brings to an organization. Through your proven experience in B2B -SaaS product marketing, you have learned how to keep your eye on the big picture and execute on what needs to get done to move the needle.

We are looking for an experienced, collaborative, and driven Product Marketing Industry Lead, who will take Canvass AI to new heights and drive rapid growth across existing and new markets. You will be responsible for core go-to-market activism and ongoing product success - defining product positioning through a deep understanding of the market, buyers, and key competitors. You will synthesize information and serve as an internal and external evangelist and influencer to ensure the sales, marketing, and customer success are equipped with the right tools, knowledge, and information to properly position Canvass AI to win in the market.

Key Responsibilities

  • Conceptualize, build and analyze various marketing plans, strategies and campaigns to power the growth of Canvass AI’s brand and product.
  • Develop and launch campaigns to support our GTM (go to market) initiatives.
  • Develop targeted and meaningful content, product positioning and messaging that differentiates Canvass AI capabilities across the industry.
  • Communicate the value proposition of Canvass AI’s platform and capabilities to sales enablement and develop assets and sales tools that support the sales cycle.
  • Participate in the launch of new product releases and manage the cross-functional implementation of industry-agnostic plans.
  • Work closely with our Product Management and Go-To-Market teams to develop enablement content, product demos, sales tools and strategies.
  • Help drive market intelligence through in-depth industry and competitive analysis, while consistently devising programs to outpace the competition.
  • Develop the strategy and manage the marketing programs that drive demand within the industry.
  • Work with our broader marketing team to develop thought leadership and increase awareness of Canvass AI for expert data scientist user personas, influencers, and decision makers.
  • Create and maintain a crystal clear and highly compelling product messaging matrix.
  • Create and shape customer personas.
  • Track competitive marketing landscape against category.
  • Empower sales with competitive intelligence, and create and maintain competitor talking tracks, battle cards, cheat sheets, FAQs, and training.

Qualifications

  • SaaS product marketing experience is a must.
  • 8-10 years of work experience in B2B Product Marketing and/or Product Management.
  • Deep understanding of machine learning and analytic applications, especially in production / operational environments.
  • Demonstrated success in product launches and end-to-end execution of supporting marketing strategies.
  • Excellent communication skills a must; written and oral, including presentation and product demonstration experience to large and diverse audiences. You have a knack for developing compelling, differentiated, and memorable product narratives.
  • Analyst relations experience with firms such as Forrester and Gartner.
  • You enjoy collaborating with passionate cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, product management, marketing, customer success).
  • Roll up your sleeve get stuff done attitude with high growth start-up experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field.

Your Benefits

Some of the benefits you can expect as part of our team include:

  • Awesome team and culture (every day)
  • Generous time off, including vacation and personal days to help rejuvenate
  • Extended health benefits, including drug coverage, dental coverage, and a Health Spending Account
  • Flexible office policy, with options to work remotely
  • Attend Conferences to extend your knowledge and skills
  • Company-provided MacBooks and standing desks
  • Top technology and tools to excel at your role
  • Free team lunches

Why Join Canvass?

Canvass Analytics is using AI to automate operations for the Industrial sector. We are changing the way industry thinks and uses AI, and it’s getting noticed everywhere.  We’ve been recognized by Network World as a Top 10 Hot AI-Powered IoT Startups and by Canadian Innovation Exchange as a Top 20 Most Innovative Canadian Company. Canvass is backed by Google’s Gradient Ventures.

​What\'s it like working at Canvass?

This is a place where everyone is all in.  From the CEO to the newest hire, we all pitch in where needed and do what it takes.  We are a relatively flat organization where everyone is invited to the table, to listen in and be part of the conversation and decisions.  We have an inclusive culture

item.title: Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst
item.description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us! 

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst position in Toronto, Ontario for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst is responsible for developing a deep understanding of CN’s customer needs within the organization’s competitive environment through market research and data analytics to support the International Intermodal Marketing team in expanding our market share. The role represents an opportunity to learn about the International Intermodal business and gain insights into CN’s Consumer Products Supply Chain as goods move across North America from production to final delivery. Moreover, the incumbent will gain an understanding of pricing, contract management, revenue tracking, and creating supply chain solutions as they relate to intermodal transportation.

Major Responsibilities

  • Administer specific pricing and marketing activities, including contract and price application
  • Generate reports and collaborate in analysis
  • Assess market and modal competition, costs, service requirements and equipment availability
  • Undertake research related to corridor pricing structure and modal competition
  • Perform market research including competitive market data

Requirements

  • Ability to translate market information and trends into business decisions
  • Ability to identify key issues that affect CN\'s competitive position
  • Initiative, sound judgment, and accountability
  • Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Ability to prioritize in an efficient manner

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, or equivalent field

About CN  

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results. 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Business Analysis
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Business Analysis is responsible for identifying, eliciting, analyzing, specifying, and validating the business needs of users throughout CN and for specific projects or initiatives in the area of Rail Operational Technology. The Specialist acts as a liaison between the I&T groups (architecture, design, delivery, quality assurance, project management) and the business and translates needs into detailed stakeholder requirements/user stories, which the Specialist will follow through the project life cycle.

At CN, we are currently prioritizing the rail automation (Train Protection, Train Control, Automated rail and train inspections). The objectives of these initiatives increase rail safety through better monitoring and control of train movements. It consists of highly advanced operational technologies designed to improve safety and operational efficiency.

Main Responsibilities

Gathering and Managing Business Needs

·       Express business requirements in user stories

·       Elicit and document business requirements from internal and external partners (User Stories, Use Case, Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTMs), Workflow Diagrams, Responsible, Accountable, Consulting, Informed Matrix (RACI), etc.)

·       Define the business and solution requirements

·       Understand the solution gaps and communicate the impacts to the business

·       Maintain requirements changes traceability

·       Analyze, clarify and prioritize project requirements

·       Work with the product manager to ensure that the Product Backlog is visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the teams will work on next

·       Liaison between business and implementation teams

·       Work closely with business partners and key IT groups (Architecture, Design, Change Management, Quality Assurance, Delivery, Project Management, etc.) to ensure successful project delivery

·       Apply, and ensure compliance with, all CN IT standards (Security, Architecture, Project Delivery Methodology, SOX, etc.)

·       Manage requirements throughout the life of the project

 

Cross Project Integration

·       Lead cross-functional collaboration with other projects or programs to validate business needs

·       Understand cross-project dependencies to align project deliverables

Business Analysis Practice Development

·       Work closely with the Business Analysis Lead and other I&T stakeholders on the continuous improvement of the business analysis framework and toolkit

Working Conditions

The Specialist may be required to travel occasionally in North America.

Requirements

Experience

Relevant Work Experience

·       Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in business analysis and processes

·       Experience with system interface/ICD analysis

·       Experience with process mapping and project management methodology

·       Experience with software development

·       Experience with Data Analytics

·       Experience with communications protocols

·       Experience working in a safety environment

·       Experience within the rail industry, transportation, aerospace or telecom is considered an asset

·       Familiar with Agile methodologies

 

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems or other relevant fields

·       IIBA Certification*

·       CBAP Certification*

·       SAFe Certification*

·       Scrum Master and/or Product Owner Certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Works independently with little supervision and self-starter

·       Demonstrated success working with business and engineering teams to plan, develop, refine, and launch successful solution deliveries / products

·       Demonstrated ability to organize and facilitate workshops, interviews, and meetings, mindful of the impact of organizational change

·       Demonstrated ability to analyze, synthesize, document, translate and communicate business information to technical teams and vice versa

·       Excellent verbal and written communication and negotiation skills

·       Experience working with complex systems in large organizations

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Facilitation techniques

·       Process mapping

·       JIRA tool

·       Confluence tool

 

 About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.


 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Expert, Network Security Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The purpose of this role is to evaluate network solutions, configurations, and designs against security requirements, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all network environments at CN.

Main Responsibilities

Network Security Architecture Practice 

  • Put in place the proper sets of network security architecture controls to manage safety and security risk while enabling the business for technology systems such as: service-oriented-architectures; cloud technologies and containers; advanced analytics; AI; Industrial IoT;, networking infrastructure; mobile technologies; etc.
  • Ensure the network security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented.
  • Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to network security architecture.
  • Facilitate key decisions involving network architecture and technologies.
  • Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.
  • Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents.

Network Security Roadmap and Strategy

  • Collaborate with the CISO, Sr Mgr Network Security Architecture, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture. 
  • Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps.
  • Engage the network security vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners.
  • Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies.

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field
  • At least one recognized network security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED), Cisco Certified Internetworking Expert (CCIE) – Security, Palo Alto Networks Certified Network Security Engineer (PCNSE), etc.
  • Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred

Skills/Knowledge

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc;
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement;
  • Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems;
  • Proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations;
  • Strong knowledge of the technologies and architecture principles required to secure complex network environments such as: 802.1X, Cisco ISE, packet capture and analysis, NetFlow, SFlow, NGFW, Zero Trust, VPN, VLANs, IDS, IPS, ACLs, device authentication, network behavior anomaly detection, SOAR, firewall configuration management, DDoS protection, etc;
  • Deep understanding of network protocols and standard approaches for network segmentation.
  • Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs;
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation;
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment;
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP;

Experience 

  • Minimum 12 years overall IT work experience 
  • Minimum 8 years network security experience 
  • Minimum 5 years experience in network security architecture

Assets (if applicable)

  • Virtual appliance configuration experience
  • Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies 
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc.
  • In depth understanding of infrastructure and network architecture and design, LAN/WAN implementation, and Windows/Linux environments
  • Deep knowledge of security foundations: cryptography, Root of Trust, security models, etc. 
  • Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus

Working Conditions 

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email. 

Effective November 1, 2021,CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition ofemployment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of ourwholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents andsuppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist- Data Engineering
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Specialist Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Specialist Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering – 60%

·       Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

·       Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

·       Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

·       Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

·       Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

·       Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

·       Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

·       Promote effective data management practices

Data Design - 10%

·       Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

·       Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

·       Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

·       Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

·       Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

·       Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development - 10%

·       Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

·       Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

·       Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

·       Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations - 10%

·       Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

·       Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

·       Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

·       Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance - 10%

·       Use Agile development practises for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

·       Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

·       Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

 

Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

·       Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

·       Experience with Scala or Java

·       Experience with SQL and NoSQL technologies

·       Fluent in writing, executing, and optimizing SQL queries

·       Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hive and Spark

·       Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

·       Experience with Linux and shell scripting or Python

·       Experience in data profiling

·       Develop clean and maintainable code in a CI/CD environment (DevOps)

·       Experience in writing unit tests

·       Experience in translating business requirements into advanced data models able to fulfill analysts and data scientists requirements

.      Experience working in an Agile team environment

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

·       Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

 .     Strong interpersonal relations, motivated and loves to work on multiple challenging projects

·       Well organized and able to self-prioritize, sometimes with conflictual deadlines

·       Continuously seeks for improvements and craves to put hands on new technologies

·       Ability to communicate complex solutions

·       Applies analytical thinking

·       Innovates through problem solving

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Works independently with little supervision

·       Applies agile mindset

·       Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

·       Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Strong data analytics and development skills

·       Demonstrated creativity skills

·       Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

·       Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

·       Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

·       Expertise with Apache Storm*

·       Expertise with Databricks Delta Lake*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The Specialist Data Engineering is accountable for working with business stakeholders, Data and IT subject matter experts, and business leads to plan and delivery on the strategy and implementation roadmap of data pipelines.

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Specialist Data Engineering interacts primarily (80%) with internal stakeholders and partially (20%) with external contacts.

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Data Science Specialist
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The role of Data Science Specialist is to ensure successful deployment of advanced infrastructure, telecom, machine learning, Industrial IoT, software development, application, and technology solutions, systems and services.  The specialist ensures that all business requirements are met by team members and projects, and contributes to the global evolution of CN’s I&T.

Clients can be from within CN’s I&T team or direct lines of business. The specialist  must build a full-time automated service between systems in the cloud for the positive train control with the machine learning and AI.   Be part of the system architecture for infrastructure as a code and Work CICD tool with azure DevOPS.  Be part of the technology exploration service to build the evolution of the existing services. Develop and maintain a virtualized and containerized infrastructure. Building test code, new design and optimisation monitoring tool.  Be part of the DevOPS team and lead after action review for operation support.

 

Main Responsibilities

·       Full stack development of AI Feature and application in various area.

·       Identify Models to be used and improve model accuracy

·       Participate in the product definition, especially around the aspect of AI, machine learning, to translate complex business requirement into concrete technical solution.

·       Create new optimisation for Infra monitoring with integration with third party or internal script(s).

·       Develop new way to get information from the application to get more data for the monitoring

·       Use the data in the log management for pattern recognition

·       Develop cloud design pattern for availability, data management, design and implementation, management and monitoring.

·       Build the structure for process and documentation

·       Be able to build solution with the Azure, Google cloud platform and DevOps marketplace.

·       Evolve and build best practice materials

·       Enable development teams to leverage cloud-native architectures with new and existing applications.

·       Build workshops and labs about cloud technologies, cloud operations, containers, orchestrators and microservices.

·       Be the technical leader for the system integration dev ops

 

Requirements

·       Minimum of 5 years of experience.

·       Computer Science or Engineering degree

·       Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)

·       Strong familiarity with CNN for objects detection, segmentation and classification.

·       Strong Familiarity with machine learning application to time series analysis.

·       Experience with Tensorflow, Keras, Spark, Opencv, Pytorch, etc

·       Strong Knowledge in machine learning or AI feature and application in the SaaS software

·       Experience with Natural language processing, text understanding, classification, pattern recognition, recommendation systems, targeting systems, ranking systems or similar

·       Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Gitlab CI, Github Actions, etc)

·       In-depth experience gathering and interpreting business requirements to design and create scalable data science solutions

·       Familiarity with SQL, Hadoop, Hive, Spark Databases

·       Familiarity with MLFlow and pipeline monitoring

·       Experience working in Agile environments

·       Experience working with Big Data Analytics

·       Strong knowledge about coding in Python, Java.

·       Strong knowledge how to monitor application and infrastructure

·       Knowledge in logs management, application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring

·       Knowledge of monitoring and logging for containers and orchestrators.

·       Familiar with ISO30162 and IoT

 

 

Assets

  • Master or Ph.D in Computer Science, AI, machine learning or related technical field.
  • Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, Google)

·       Knowledge of networking, security and protocol

·       PTC and Rail industry experience

·       IoT experience

·       MLOps Experience

·       Great Communication skills

·       Out of the box thinker

·       Devops Certification

·       Azure certification (developing solution)

·       Google certification

 

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

item.title: Supervisor Rail and Quality
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you are part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. 

    Join us!

    Job Summary

    The Supervisor, Testing and Rail Quality is responsible for extending CN’s rail life by maintaining the rail test frequencies and quality of rail testing. The role involves visiting sites along CN’s network to carry out rail flaw detection, welding audits and procedures, investigate in-service rail failures and lubrication, or friction modifications. The incumbent will be required to manage both direct and indirect reports, and develop the initial strategy on how to extend rail life to ensure it’s effective and efficient operation across Canada and the US.

    Main Responsibilities

    Rail Flaw Detection

    • Carry out daily reporting to ensure continued performance of vehicles
    • Run and review daily reports (4 to 5) generated per vehicle
    • Ensure reporting and billing is accurate
    • Ensure remedial actions are correct and that testing was carried out properly
    • Schedule vehicles and provide weekly updates
    • Participate in daily calls with Operators
    • Contact dispatch centers for any issues regarding track time

    Welding Audits and Procedures

    • Visit sites to inspect and audit tracks, and ensure appropriate Track Standards are followed
    • Carry out dynamic audits of welders
    • Measure recent welds to ensure that they meet CN’s established standards

     

    Investigate In-Service Rail Failures

    • Carry out in-depth investigation(s), as necessary (e.g. rail breakage, joints pull apart)
    • Receive and study pictures from Track Supervisors and/or local forces
    • Determine the root cause of the failure, provide the details of the last rail flaw detection tape analysis, site analysis of track geometry, detail Rail Severity Index with Track Quality Index and provide recommendations
    • Write up synopsis and communicate to Regional Chiefs of Engineering

    Friction Modification

    • Visit territories and carry out physical location and inspection of Friction modifiers
    • Ensure Friction modifiers are working as designed
    • Provide recommendations to Manager, Rail Testing and Quality
    • Carry out accounting audits to monitor grease usage and reduce expenses, where possible

    Grinding

    • Check quality of the grind and functionality of grinding machines regularly
    • Schedule grinders
    • Approve daily invoices (e.g. water trucks, etc.)
    • Schedule Rail Inspection Vehicles (RIV)

     

    People Management

    • Establish employee objectives and carry out regular touch-base meetings
    • Provide mentorship, guidance, support, coaching, and feedback to direct reports
    • Train and mentor new staff
    • Communicate company policies and goals to staff
    • Prepare and monitor development plan for staff 

    Working Conditions

     

    The role requires frequent travel (80%) to field sites across CN’s network both in Canada and the US. The role will be primarily performed outdoors in various types of weather and environmental conditions. The role requires being available on-call 24/7 to respond to critical incidences.

    Requirements

    Experience

    Rail Flaw Detection, Welding, Grinding, Lubrication

    • Minimum 5 years of experience in rail flaw detection, welding, grinding and lubrication
      • Data analytics
      • Track maintenance or building*

     

    Management

    • Between 2 to 3 years in a large organization
      • Unionized employees*
      • Production line employees*

    *Any experience for these above would be considered as an asset

    Education/Certification/Designation

    • High School Diploma
    • Valid driver’s license

    Competencies

    • Follows safety procedures, information security instructions and ESC principles to lead by example
    • Identifies risks and anticipates impacts to ensure a safe and secure environment
    • Addresses risks in a timely manner to eliminate them
    • Shares timely information within and across functions to get things done effectively
    • Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts well to its audience
    • Makes informed and timely decisions to succeed
    • Fluently bilingual both written and verbal (English, French)*

    *Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

    Technical Skills/Knowledge

    • General Microsoft Computer Skills
    • Railroad safety regulatory requirements
    • Knowledge of conducting investigations after a critical incident
    • Transport Canada, Federal Railroad Administration, Department of Transportation, Ministry of Transportation
    • CPR*

    *Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

    Organizational Impact

    Decision Making & Impacts

    Daily decisions made by the incumbent have a direct impact on the vehicles and commodities travelling across CN’s rail network, as well as its customer base. Decisions are made regularly which affect the safety of CN<s community and can be the cause of critical incidences if not made correctly or in a timely manner.

    Level of Interaction/Influence

    The Supervisor, Testing and Rail Quality’s first line of communication is the Track Supervisor and Senior Manager Engineering on the Engineering zones. The incumbent also communicates regularly with the Chief Dispatcher, as well as various internal stakeholders, including high-level managers and Vice-Presidents across Transportation and Operations.

    Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

    The Supervisor, Testing and Rail Quality reports directly to the Manager, Testing and Rail Quality. The role is responsible for managing 2 direct reports (unionized and non-unionized) as well as 40 indirect reports (contractors/non-unionized/unionized).

    About CN

    CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

     

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.  The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

 

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;  master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation  requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

 

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business  rules profiling

Performs data  quality  assessment and quality  metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

 

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

 

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

 

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or  Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations. 

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

 

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Specialist Data Design
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The role of Specialist Data Design works with manager, expert data design and data governance to drive best practices and a practice-based approach towards data design and management is responsible for working on collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing sets of data. The primary focus is on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them. They are also responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Design - 55%

•          Create and maintain optimal data modeling and pipeline architecture

•          Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements

•          Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.

•          Extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources

•          Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics

•          Work with stakeholders including the architecture, product management, infrastructure, data and design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs

•          Keep our data separated and secure across the data lake/warehouse to adhere to industry and regulatory requirements

•          Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader

•          Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems

•          Follow standard and best practices to ensure the data design is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented with all the associated IP constructs

•          Follow standards and best practices to ensure reliability, safety and cybersecurity standards are imbedded in the data design and sub systems

•          Understand rail architecture in order to develop data models and understanding of all integrations

Delivery & Quality - 45%

•          Work with the development team to ensure data design is fully understood and developed with high quality

•          Work closely with functional and technical leads to define relationships between business objects (entities) and how these objects will interact with the solution processes

•          Perform data source discovery through reverse engineering, data readiness assessments and analysis

•          Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management

•          Work with quality leads, management, and quality assurance to constantly monitor quality KPI’s and implement data design improvements

•          Perform root cause analysis to support development process

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

·       Collaborate with expert data designer and governance specialists to design and document various data management patterns and flows

·       Has a direct impact on the quality of the data design and standards used to deliver

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

 ·       Collaborate with expert data designer and governance specialists to drive the data design

·       Collaborate with architecture, product management, infrastructure and end users to fully design best in class solutions

 Employees supervised/Org Structure

·       Individual Contributor

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

•          Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or equivalent degree & experience

 

Skills/Knowledge

•          Good knowledge of data engineering and design principles

•          Ability to analyze, design and document detailed data designs

•          Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases

•          Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets

•          Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management

•          Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing and highly scalable ‘big data’ data store

•          Strong organizational skills and can work autonomously to provide data solutions

•          Good oral and written skills

 

Specific Skills per Specialty

Data Hub

•     Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.

•     Experience building and optimizing Hadoop data pipelines, architectures, and data sets

•     Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including Postgres and Mongo DB

•     Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.

•     Experience with relational data warehouse databases like Netezza, DB2

•     Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases

•     Experience with modeling tools, specially ERWin

 

Experience

•          Minimum 5-10 year overall work experience

•          Minimum 5 years of analysis, data design and data modeling experience 

•          Minimum 4 years of data quality related experience (with or without tool-based solutions)

•          Strong experience in process analysis and workflow modeling

•          Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement

•          A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, disconnected datasets

Assets

·       Experience in working with Agile and DevOps development organizations

·       Knowledge of transportation, PTC, and Rail is a definite asset 

 

AboutCN

CNis a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to theeconomy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safelytransports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufacturedproducts, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the onlyrailroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tipof the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have beencontributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN iscommitted to programs supporting social responsibility and environmentalstewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability andour customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliverresults.
