item.title: Expert DevSecOps
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

This role is to provide governance within the DevSecOps practice to ensure quality and standards are defined and used by our CN community. The Expert is also responsible for the secure design, development, implementation and support of the platforms and its tools. The Expert define and documents the agreed standards and processes and coaches/mentors the other DevOps specialists to guide the CN team using them. As a DevSecOps Expert you will work collaboratively with the continuous integration and software engineering teams to deliver and operate development & test systems. You will oversee help the automation and streamline product operations and processes; build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations; and troubleshoot / resolve issues in our development, test and production environments and act on occasion in the role of a key systems administrator for various DevOps systems.

 

Main Responsibilities

DevSecOps

  • Manage shared systems and services, docker orchestrator, service registry, secrets management and more.
  • Write production-quality tools to reduce toil for the engineering team and help automate the technical ecosystem to help us scale.
  • Assist other teams to utilize our observability tools and scripts to debug production systems.
  • Shape the technologies used to solve some of our fundamental challenges (e.g. CI/CD, container orchestration, logging, security, etc.)
  • Design and write secure, robust, testable and scalable pipeline template code and consistent design patterns.
  • Evaluate emerging technologies to identify new opportunities, trends and best practices
  • Architect solutions which help projects and multifaceted teams deliver
  • Mentor and coach other devops members within the devsecops practice
  • Administer, support and maintain existing platform components within the DevSecOps practice
  • Evaluate and implement new platform components that can help or improve the teams that use the tools

 

Requirements

Experience

  • Minimum 7-10 years overall work experience in Developement
  • Minimum 5-7 years overall work experience in DevOps and Cloud
  • Experience designing, configuring, and deploying DevOps systems and tools
  • Knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes, an asset
  • Multi-cloud experience including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform, an asset
  • Experience with Agile and SAFe methodologies, an asset
  • Experience with the duties required of a SRE, an asset

 

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or another relevant field
  • DevOps Certification an asset
  • Azure certification an asset
  • Google certification an asset
  • Security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), GIAC Cloud Security Automation (GCSA), etc. an asset

 

General Skills and Competencies

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc.
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement
  • Ability to derive requirements from vaguely formulated business needs
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment
  • Work closely with Development Architects, Cloud Architects and other Development/Cloud Specialists. Interact with project teams (functional, development and test leads, project managers and Architects).
  • Position current technology capabilities in the direction of their roadmap and influence Product Owners, Product Managers to adhere to them.
  • Identify and drive opportunities to improve automation for code deployment, management, and visibility of application services
  • Develop tools and framework to automate operational tasks, deployment of machines, services, and applications

 

Technical Skills

  • Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems in private and public clouds
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. OWASP
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults, Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc., an asset
  • Understanding of securing APIs, an asset
  • Knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes, an asset

 

Additional Skills

  • Fluent in two or more of the following programming languages Python, Go, PowerShell, YAML and Bash
  • Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, etc.)
  • Knowledge of DevOps Security tools (DAST, SATS, IAST) such as Fortify on Demand, SonarQube, BlackDuck.
  • Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, Google)
  • Strong knowledge of Docker and creation/maintenance of dockerfiles
  • Strong knowledge of Kubernetes and creation/maintenance of Kubernetes manifests
  • Experience with Helm and Terraform
  • Experience with Secret Managers (i.e. HashCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, Google Cloud Key Management, etc.)
  • Experience in designing multistage pipeline flows including CI/CD/CT
  • Experience in administering Linux and Windows systems
  • Familiar with Identity and Access Management (IAM) including RBAC
  • Experience programing using API (RESTful, gRPC, GraphQL, etc.)
  • Familiar with backend server architectures using Service Oriented Architecture or Micro-services design methodologies
  • Good knowledge of Agile project management writing Features, Stories, Tasks and delivering in Sprints and PIs.
  • Ability to accurately estimate efforts of the tasks assigned
  • Proactive, able to plan, address or mitigate technical risk
  • Ability to understand a problem, identify its root and find technical solutions
  • Ability to work on multiple projects in parallel and meet deliverables dates
  • Very good technical documentation skills
  • Strong communication, influencing and presentation skills
  • Leadership skills and ability to influence and guide others on integration and technical matters
  • Proven experience delivering technology projects involving multiple parties
  • Knowledge of IT security principles
  • Ability to clarify requirements and ensure solution meets business needs
  • Strong systems engineering knowledge
  • Ability to navigate within a complex I&T organization
  • Ability to lead in ambiguous situations
  • Strong sense or prioritization for meeting deadlines
  • Strong knowledge how to monitor application and infrastructure
  • Knowledge in logs management, application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring
  • Knowledge of monitoring and logging for containers and orchestrators.
  • Knowledge of networking, security, and protocols
  • Knowledge of SSO, OAuth 2.0 OpenID Connect (OIDC) and SAML 2.0 a plus.
  • IoT experience a plus

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high quality data, and a data-product oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.


We are entrepreneurial, and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment. The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web-visualizations, we do it all!


Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!
 

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. As a Senior Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.


Here\'s how

 

  •  Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • Demonstrated ability to lead end-to-end iterative development of data-driven solutions to business challenges including problem definition, hypotheses generation and development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Ability to independently lead value generation, measured in terms of EBITDA generated, for a business area/function; this includes managing and delivering a portfolio of use-cases by collaborating with business stakeholders and members within our team
  • Demonstrated aptitude to mentor and coach junior team members on both technical aspects of Data Science as well as its application to solve business challenges
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring at least 6 years of hands-on work and relevant experience in these areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

#Canada #LI-Remote

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  •  You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including regression, classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, and optimization and bring 4+ years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences

  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications
  • Experience with Bayesian / Belief Networks, and Causal Inference
  • Back end/API development experience
     

#DSEjobs

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - C360 Insights Team
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

The C360 Insights Team is part of the Campaign Management & Data Science group that supports one to one Marketing Campaigns for TELUS’ Mobility Customers. Our team is responsible for providing advanced analytics solutions to inform marketing campaigns that help deliver best in class customer experiences and business results for the organization. We develop machine learning and AI solutions leveraging the latest technology and Big Data assets that TELUS maintains.

 

We are a team of highly skilled and experienced data analytics professionals with diverse industry experience who collaborate to create value for our customers, organization and team.

 

Always wanted to work in a high performance team that strives to continuously grow and be part of a culture that embraces creativity, collaboration, diversity and a whole lot of fun? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist, reporting to the Manager C360 Insights Team, you will play a pivotal role in enabling TELUS’ Marketing teams to achieve their business goals including revenue, EBITDA, churn, customer experience by developing advanced analytics solutions that support marketing strategy and campaigns.

 

As TELUS evolves its AI capabilities including Next Best Action engines, Customer Journey analytics solutions and transition to Cloud platforms you will be a key contributor and user of these capabilities.

 

You will work with a talented team of Data Scientists as well as analytics and marketing professionals to build advanced analytics solutions and derive business value from them.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Contribute to the development of teams’ deliverables like Next Best Action engines, Propensity Models, Natural Language Processing models, Near Real time Triggers, Customer Journey Analytics, Data Dashboards that inform marketing strategy and campaigns leveraging PySPARK, Python, SQL, etc
  • Own the end-to-end analysis including pre-analysis, trigger detection, predictive modeling and post campaign analysis
  • Present customer insights to cross-functional business partners including Marketing, Channel, Products & Services, Customer Experience and Digital
  • Support the transition of TELUS’ data assets and analytics machine learning solutions to Google Cloud Platform ensuring data security and privacy compliance
  • Maintain solid and updated knowledge in the domain of AI/ machine learning to continuously evolve TELUS’s AI assets while collaborating with and adding value to your fellow data science community
  • Work collaboratively with business partners teams to understand, compartmentalize complex and ambiguous business issues into crisp and manageable pieces

 

 

Qualifications

 

Must haves

 

  • Technical Expertise
    • Extensive Hands-on and industry experience in Python, SPARK, SQL and other data query language on UNIX / PC and comfortable working with very large data sets and databases
    • Extensive Hands-on experience with a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks
    • Knowledge of advanced statistical and data mining techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with business applications
    • Experience with Data Visualization tools like Domo/Tableau
    • Strong Quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills
    • 8+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
  • Business Orientation
    • Good business acumen, relationship management and influencing without authority skills
    • Ability to provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis
    • Strong Ability to prioritize tasks from multiple stakeholders and meet deadlines with quality deliverables
    • Strong written, oral, communications, presentation skills and knowledge of Microsoft office/Google suite
  • Education
    • Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science Engineering/ Programming/ Statistics/Analytics

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Telecom industry experience
  • Working experience with Google Cloud Platform

 

Above all else we are seeking an enthusiastic ‘let’s do it’ attitude, motivation and a willingness to learn and collaborate. Please consider transferable skills, which will make you successful in this role and apply!

item.title: Senior Data Scientist - TELUS Insights
item.description:
Description

 

The IoT Industry Solutions team is "start-up" within TELUS that is focused on building end-to-end customer solutions that combine the strengths of our networks, leading SaaS and platform partnerships, our breadth of customer relationships, and the power of data insights. We own the success of focused vertical and horizontal IoT solutions across Intelligent Mobility, Connected Workers, Smart City, Agriculture, and Health.

We\'re passionate about building new business areas for TELUS and will succeed by bringing clarity and focus to the challenge. 

About the team

This role is part of the Data and Applied Intelligence team within IoT Industry Solutions. We are a provider of data, insights and data science services to commercial and government organizations. Our product solves many business problems across a wide variety of industries. They are currently being used in Tourism, Commercial Real Estate, Transportation and many other industries to help decision makers plan their next course of action or analyze their historical activities. We are a fun group of individuals, who are really passionate about our products and committed to provide quality solutions to our customers.

About the role

 

  • Design and build large and complex data sets, from spurious sources while thinking strategically about uses of data and how data use interacts with data design
  • Design and implement statistical data quality procedures for new data sources
  • Develop algorithms/software for accessing and handling data appropriately
  • Implement and hand off data checking and updating procedures to teams
  • Lead the new product developments for the TELUS Insights portfolio and product enhancements for existing location intelligence products
  • Scale the current custom consulting projects to a generalized product that could be reused for multiple clients across multiple verticals
  • Develop and implement ML & AI and Big Data solutions including predictive modeling,forecasting and classification
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that appropriately provides insights to the organization
  • Train others on what data is available and how to use various sources
  • Communicate findings to business leaders in a way that can influence how an organization approaches a business challenge
  • Support and evolve the TELUS Insights product roadmap by leveraging customer insights, industry research, best practices, and emerging tools/technology
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You have 5+ years of experience working with large temporal geospatial datasets
  • MSc. or PhD/Research in Computer Science, Statistics, Geospatial etc. 
  • You possess deep expertise in location intelligence/ Geospatial data
  • Working with structured and unstructured data sets
  • Excellent skills working with complex SQL and Spark
  • Experience developing in Python; comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras
  • Experience building and architecting API endpoints
  • Experience working with telecom background is a plus
  • Experience working with cloud environments like GCP 
  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics, and other advanced analytical techniques
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning, Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, Time Series Analysis, Demand Forecasting and Optimization
  • Evaluating and providing input on potential business intelligence solutions.
  • Comfortable with Jupyter environment and infrastructure, Spyder/PyCharm
  • Experience with at least one of the major cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Well versed in software development lifecycle and ML Ops concepts; Developing end-end to models/ projects and automation in production environment.
  • Knowledgeable about common supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning approaches (eg. feature engineering, classification, regression, clustering, NLP, time series forecasting, etc. "Tensorflow”, “Deep Learning” and synthetic tabular data generation is a strong asset

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • PhD in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle
  • Experience using Google Workspace 
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA)

 

MBIOT22  #LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior RF Design Specialist
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Designers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Designers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

TELUS is searching for a Designer with extensive experience in RF Design, strong business acumen and leadership skills. As a Senior RF Designer, you will collaborate closely with the client-facing business units offering solutions to future & existing customers in a variety of business different verticals. Your leadership and creativity will serve to understand the customer’s challenges and to design a technical solution that surpasses their expectations by leveraging all that 5G has to offer.

What you’ll do 

 

  • Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
  • Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • Leveraging data analytics to define future network deployment strategy in a variety of business verticals.
  • Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
  • Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools

 

 

Qualification


What you bring

 

  • Bachelor degree in Engineering ( Electrical or Computer) 
  • Advanced presentation & communication skills. The successful candidate will be called upon to present highly technical material in an easily digestible manner at all levels of the organization and to potential customers
  • Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
  • A minimum of 10-year minimum experience in an RF engineering team, with a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
  • Experience in designing macro sites, small cells & and in-building coverage solutions
  • A sound knowledge of 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
  • A strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
  • Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Master degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • MBA or similar business training certifications
  • Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx

item.title: Senior Product Owner, AI Products & Platform | TELUS Digital
item.description:
Description


Join our team 

The AI Products & Platform team is an agile team focused on building machine learning applications which enable dynamic experiences that adapt to the behaviour of our customers. Some of the solutions we’ve worked on include product & article recommendation, fraud detection, lead scoring and natural language analysis. Our team of data scientists, analysts and engineers allows us to build end to end solutions from data ingestion to model serving.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

As a Product Owner on the AI Products & Platform team, you will be responsible to enable TELUS team members to understand how machine learning can be embedded into customer interactions to drive business benefits such as RGUs and self-serve benefits. To do this, you will manage stakeholder requirements & documentations, drive data privacy processes, and facilitate cross-collaboration effort of both technical and business team members across organization. 

This is a full-time, permanent position. Remote work is available anywhere in Canada.  #LI-Remote
 

Here’s how: 
 

  • Drive AI Products and Platform maturity with TELUS by designing machine learning solutions working with our data science, analytics, and ML Ops Engineering teams
  • Develop roadmap for various AI enablement and analytical use cases to deliver tangible EBIDTA or opex effort reduction business outcomes
  • Business casing to project the value of embedding machine learning solutions into different areas of the business
  • Partner with teams within TELUS Digital and wider TELUS to ensure our team drives what’s needed to fulfill both short- and long-term company goals
  • Overseeing, assisting, and prioritizing team’s in-flight workload and backlog of user stories that will drive customer value and help reduce customer effort
  • Focus on outcomes, working through ambiguity & delivering with a "no task is too big or too small" attitude
  • Having a healthy obsession for finding “better ways” to do things


 

Qualifications


You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle: 
 

  • Known for your intellectual curiosity, grit, and a genuine passion for solving problems with machine learning and predictive analytics
  • A knack for building interpersonal relationships with a variety of stakeholders ( Both business and technical)
  • Familiar with JIRA, Confluence, Waterfall and Agile SDLC practices in order to support Developers, Tech Leads, PO’s, Architects, Analysts
  • You are an entrepreneur and self-motivating, with experience leading product departments
  • You use both quantitative and qualitative research to improve the product
  • Ability to influencing without authority when managing complex, cross-functional programs


 

Great-to-haves
 

  • Foundational knowledge of machine learning and Google Cloud Platform
  • Ability to perform ad-hoc data analysis to quantify various metrics
  • Understanding of the digital landscape and data analytics tools and trends
  • Post-secondary education in related disciplines such as digital, business/marketing, AI, analytics



About TELUS Digital

 

 

Who we are:

We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. 
 

TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, business.telus.com and the My Account app.
 

Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts. 
 

Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!
 

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital

 


We want to work with people who:
 

  • Share our passion for all things digital
  • Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
  • Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
  • Embrace diversity and new ideas

 


What you can expect from us:
 

  • An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas
  • Flexible work hours in a remote first, mobile environment
  • A welcoming, relaxed office environment
  • A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
  • A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing

 


Bonus points

Check out https://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

JOIN OUR TEAM

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE), TELUS and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) to a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategy.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end to end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards and data engineering ETLs using cutting edge Cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal to enable data-driven decision making in CPO, PACE team is looking for an experienced data scientist who is able to regularly engage and interact with our business stakeholders to identify opportunities and develop complete solutions to turn data into insight for decision making.

 

What you’ll do:

 

As an experienced Data Scientist in PACE’s Insight Generation group, you will be at the front end, systematically analyzing and transforming vast amounts of tabular and unstructured data into actionable insights that are impactful in several ways to enable the organization to achieve their goals. We expect you to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen our data driven decision-making culture, improve the customer experience leading to revenue growth, cost reduction, and improved efficiency. You will be responsible to:

 

  • Work closely with business stakeholders to learn about data issues and insight gaps and take action to fill the gap
  • Work with the ‘Insight Generation ’ group within PACE and develop strategy for reporting, storytelling, and insight generation
  • Proactively looking at opportunities to blend data from across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Leverage innovative technologies and rigorous methods to extract, analyze, evaluate and interpret complex, multi-dimensional and constantly changing data
  • Question the status-quo and old processes, challenge assumptions, and advocate for AI and data-driven decision making across the chief procurement office
  • Influence PACE strategy and priorities while collaborating with other PACE team members to enable, design, develop, and deploy both data and visualization solutions
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision making
  • Provide technical coaching and mentoring to team members to ensure appropriate accessing, managing and interpretation of data

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or master with major in data science, computer science, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Tableau
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python for data science
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies to build advanced predictive models.
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data insight to business to various seniority levels of stakeholders
  • Team player

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery and AI Notebook
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • Experience in Natural Language Processing in Python
  • Experience in ML model production deployment and monitoring

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - Cloud RAN Data Scientist
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) couldifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

Introducing TELUS’ new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems. 

 

As a Data Scientist working closely with various stakeholders including TELUS’ Chief Technology Office, ORAN DevOps team, and external vendors, you play a critical role in enabling ORAN intelligent operations by developing automation policies and algorithms, workflow and data processing services.

 

What you’ll do

  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure ORAN data availability and integrity to end users
  • Responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including server Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop ORAN-Cloud orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Lead platform system issue troubleshooting and integration 
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications


What you bring

  • Working experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology and Telco OSS system
  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Expertise in NiFi setup and administration 
  • Expertise in design, development, and configuration of data processing and ETL workflow
  • Expertise in design and development using Spark, Spark Streaming, Kafka, etc.
  • Familiarity with the telecommunication industry wireless access DevOps workflows of design, plan, deployment, change management and operations. 
  • Understanding of the various phases of the Software Development Life Cycle and familiarity using Source Code and Version Control systems 
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, RESTful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform.
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernetes cloud analytics tools (such as Beats, Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

  • 5G RAN cell site deployment automation development experiences, including workflow engine, inventory databases
  • Familiarity with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi or hybrid cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor flow, Mllib, H2Oai, Kubeflow etc
  • Working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking technologies such as VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-Lag, EVPN etc.

 

ORANJobs *LI-remote *LI-hybrid

item.title: Senior Product/Project Manager - Collaborative Health
item.description:
Join our team

 

TELUS Health is transforming healthcare by delivering connected solutions and services to empower people to live healthier lives.

 

We are explorers and passionate system thinkers. We are builders and dedicated craftspeople. We are connectors and agents of change. Our thinking is grounded in an appreciation for relentless discovery, and a holistic view of the industry, market, or organization. Our efforts are grounded in a sincere commitment to translate insight into opportunity, opportunity into concepts, concepts into products and products into businesses.  We achieve this with a dedication to our craft and collaboration at our core.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

At TELUS SKY, we’ve developed a future thinking integrated ecosystem for true health, wellness and behavioral care that bridges in-person and virtual experiences. Specifically, the SKY Experience assembles people, technologies and science into a single intuitive process that combines the best of premium in-person experiences with a seamless digital platform. By doing so, we are building one of the richest databases of wellbeing biomarkers, physical, psychological, sociological indicators. Combined with advancements in artificial intelligence (AI), we will have the ability to reexamine standard assumptions of care to impact individual health journeys.

 

We are currently looking for a blend of Senior Product / Project Manager to create a frictionless digital experience, working very closely with the Sr UX / CX experience designer. In this position, you will work with cross-functional teams to analyze business requirements, research, design, integrate, and deploy new technologies. The Senior Product/Project Manager will also manage effective relationships with internal stakeholders, regional partners, technology vendors and service providers.

 

 

What you’ll do: 

 

 

  • Create and drive the integration strategy and roadmap to connect various platforms in order to provide an end to end seamless customer experience
  • Contribute to the creation of a multi-year product strategy and roadmap for SKY that expertly balances innovation with reinforcing our commitments to members
  • Work closely together with the various TELUS LoB strategy, design and product teams to identify technological integration opportunities and align on strategies, roadmaps, priorities and dependencies that provide direct business value to our SKY members.
  • Lead the execution of the developed project roadmap
  • Partner with cross-functional Product and Developer teams and industry experts to explore how Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) technologies can better support our journey.
  • Work with our data science team to create a roadmap for future automated actions based on ML models
  • Facilitate, communicate, collaborate, negotiate between customer and technical teams to bring features to closure

What you bring:

 

  • You have 2+ years of Product or 7 + years of Project Management experience, ideally in SaaS
  • You are obsessed with delivering the most customer-centric experience, showing proven success in ownership, bias for action, and thinking big.
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a relevant field, or equivalent certifications and work experience
  • Visionary, innovative, forward-thinking and profoundly customer focused
  • The flexibility to quickly adapt and produce in a rapidly changing environment, meeting aggressive product launch schedules
  • Track record working in high-growth environments, and a comfort level with the pace of change and level of ambiguity that accompanies this
  • Ability to work independently. Self-starter, can-do attitude, ability to multitask and prioritize within and across complex projects
  • Strong relationship development skills - experienced in building and strengthening internal and external relationships over time, savvy at navigating negotiations and tradeoffs with current and prospective partners
  • Broad interest in healthcare innovation that spans digital, hardware/devices, and healthcare services

 

 

Why TELUS Health?

 

At TELUS, Collaborative Health you’ll join a diverse team dedicated to learning, teaching, and impact; as individuals and as a team. As a workplace, we care about our team members and have a total rewards package that makes being a part of TELUS Health something to be proud of:

 

  • 100% remote within Canada: so you can work where you feel most inspired (in-person if YOU want to!)
  • Stay healthy: flex benefits with options to customize coverage based on your lifestyle and needs, inclusively offering coverage for Gender Affirmation and Fertility treatments
  • Virtual Care: premium access to digital healthcare for you and a loved one; avoid long waits at the clinic, just chat with a medical professional from your couch
  • Work Life Integration: paid vacation and flexible well-being days
  • Family leave: mothers, fathers and adoptive parents benefit from a top-up during part of their leave
  • Pension plan: to help you save for the future with a generous company match (free money!)
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan: you can invest in our shared success, company matched
  • Wellness Spending Account: To support your whole person wellness
  • Learning and development: Internal resources for business, leadership, and technical skills 
  • Savings: who doesn’t love discounts? (on TELUS services and partner/supplier services and products)
  • Employee and family assistance: LifeWorks provides free services to support you through life events
  • Tools/Technology: Mac or PC, whichever enables you to do your best work

 

#LI-Remote

item.title: DataOps Engineer
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team, our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment.

 

We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.
 

What you’ll do

 

  • Collaborating with Business and Product teams to enable valuable Analytics and Machine Learning use cases
  • Designing and implementing DataOps and MLOps processes and automations using the latest tools to effectively operationalize Analytics and AI workflows
  • Staying up to date of new software, tools, and organizations that are having an impact on the Analytics and Machine Learning landscape
  • Provisioning infrastructure and secure, reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP for Data & Analytics users across the TELUS enterprise
  • Identify opportunities to make substantial improvements to the deployment and support of our DataOps environment demonstrating a DevOps mindset while improving our reliability and speed to market
  • Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including building highly collaborative relationships with business product teams and technical teams

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are passionate about Agile culture and DevOps practices
  • Your have a keen interest in Data Analytics and Machine Learning, and are familiar with the machine learning life cycle
  • You have experience in implementing CI/CD processes and integrating source code version control (e.g. GitHub) with automated workflows.
  • You have hands on experience in Infrastructure-as-Code (e.g. Terraform) and programming (e.g. Python, Java)
  • You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
  • You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters, and able to translate technical considerations into business implications
  • You are capable both at a high-level when designing a solution and hands-on during implementation
  • You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
  • You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units


Great-to-haves

 

  • Undergrad in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Science or equivalent
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with data/analytics platforms, DevOps, and/or machine learning
  • Experience with the data offerings in Google Cloud Platform

item.title: Engineer II
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


 
This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. The RAN Development & New Service Introduction team is a group of highly motivated engineers who have a passion for developing and implementing new technologies to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service.

 

You will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning but also to build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.


What you’ll do 

 

  •  Responsible for LTE and 5G RAN network hardware, software, and feature new technology introduction
  • Proactively Communicate/clarify TELUS requirements to vendors and evaluates responses
  • Translate LTE/5G technical aspects into business impact and vice versa, plus E2E integration requirement 
  • Propose solutions and features optimization engineering guidelines, provide support for field teams
  • Plan the execution of the TELUS strategy and get involved in the execution 
  • Validate vendor compliance to industry/TELUS standards and the functional and performance requirements by conducting lab proof of concept and interoperability testing with other systems, etc
  • Communicate and present cross-team to explain the technical decisions and their outcomes
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps

What you bring
 

  • Solid knowledge of LTE/5G RF design and optimization (5+ years’ experience)
  • Understand future network technology evolution: HeNet (small cell), AI & Machine learning, MEC, 5G Network slicing, and SDN/virtualization, Cloud technology
  • Familiar with 3GPP spec., including air interface implementation, RRM, MM, and RF compliance
  • Understand basic knowledge of IP, Video streaming, Multicast, and other networking protocols
  • Hands-on experience with the network/performance testing tools such as IXIA, SmartBits, Chariot, QXDM, Agilent drive testing tool, XCAL, TEMS, and Actix tool IP based application knowledge and exposure to network security would also be assets
  • 5 or more years performing lab testing evaluations including and not limited to proof of concept. Experience in writing test plans for different scenarios, collecting requirements from users
  • Ability to provide on-demand, specialized technical advice for the technical solution of several wide-ranging problems and to interact with others including on a proactive customer-focused basis
  • Familiar with wireless network troubleshooting procedure and performance enhancement process with knowledge related

 
Great-to-haves

 

  • Master degree in telecom 
  • P.Eng or Eng designation

item.title: Data/ML Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

Join the Procurement Analytics Center of Excellence (PACE) and TELUS, and support our mission to transform the chief procurement office (CPO) into a fully digital organization where data is at the heart of every decision we make. Enable stakeholders to efficiently evolve and consume actionable insights through transformation strategies.

 

We are an advanced data and AI team thriving on solving business problems and supporting procurement decisions using the power of data, advanced analytics, and reliable software. We provide end-to-end support from strategy and development to deployment and monitoring of all assets, including machine learning model, Tableau dashboards, and data engineering ETLs using cutting-edge cloud technologies (e.g., Google BigQuery and GCP AI Platform), open source tools (e.g., Python, DBT, Nifi, Sklearn, NLTK, Tensorflow), and enterprise products (e.g., Tableau, GitHub, Terraform).

 

In achieving our goal of enabling data-driven decision-making in CPO, the PACE team is looking for an experienced data/ML engineer who can interpret the requirements of data and analytics use cases and scenarios, and drive the design and implementation of data pipelines and models to enable insights and analytics leading to better business decisions. 


What you’ll do:

 

As a Data/ML Engineer in PACE’s Insight Generation team, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology for continuous delivery and integration of our data and model assets. You are also accountable for ingesting data from various sources and validating, normalizing, and cleaning data for business use, and deploying & maintaining ML models in production. The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial colleagues to strengthen the availability and reliability of our data following the state-of-the-art MLOps tech stack to support our data-driven decision-making culture. In this role, you are responsible to:
 

  • Developing, maintaining, and evolving our MLOps methodology
  • Design & build data extraction, loading, and transformation pipelines, and data products across on-prem and cloud platforms
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modeling and visualization
  • Own, design, and build the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning models
  • Own and develop relationships with various internal and external teams/vendors to bring data from across the organization to our central data/ML platform in the cloud
  • Bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, standard interfaces, and APIs
  • Assist in the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data
  • Develop test strategies and site reliability engineering measures for data products & solutions
  • Supervise or contribute to quality assurance efforts to make sure that the ingested data has and keeps the expected quality
  • Look proactively at opportunities to blend data across different enterprise systems to generate actionable insights that drive business value
  • Perform technical data stewardship tasks including metadata management, security, and privacy by design
  • Mentor and coach other peers at PACE and upskill stakeholders to adopt and utilize reports, dashboards, and insights to inform day-to-day decision-making

 

Qualifications

 

Who you are:

 

  • Hold PhD or Master\'s degree with a major in computer science, software engineering, or applied mathematics (or related quantitative disciplines)
  • Minimum 7 years of experience with SQL and database proficiency
  • Minimum 5 years of experience with Python
  • Minimum 2 years of experience with databases and data pipelines on cloud platforms
  • Minimum 5 years of experience using data extraction and processing technologies.
  • Minimum 2 years of data solution architecture and design
  • Prior experience with Agile and Jira
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Ability to communicate data analytics and insights to business stakeholders
  • Ability to work and collaborate with team members

 

Great-to-have:

 

  • Knowledge and experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including Google BigQuery
  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Experience with job scheduling platforms and Orchestration (Apache NiFi, Apache airflow)
  • Familiar and preferably experienced with the life cycle of machine learning model development, deployment, and operationalization in large enterprises
  • Familiar with software development methodologies and best practices
  • DevOps and MLOPs practices and tools experience
  • Quality Assurance & Site Reliability Engineering
  • Familiarity with Data Build Tool (DBT)
  • Knowledge and experience with SAP S4 HANA, SAP ECC is a big asset

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.
 

Our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Reliability Data Engineering and Analytics Team at TELUS focusses on instantaneous detection of events that could lead to incidents, outages and negatively impact the customer experience.

 

As a Full Stack Software Developer, your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in continuing to grow our data analytics practices for predictive insights and early detection of incidents. Be a part of the team that uses cutting edge technology to implement machine learning and predictive analytics which will shape tomorrow\'s AI Ops. 

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Collaborating with other designers, engineers and DevOps team members
  • Creating beautiful and fast code that improves our code base in meaningful ways
  • Using test-driven development to write well-tested codes
  • Fixing bugs fast and solving hard problems well
  • Curiosity and passion to constantly learn new things

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • University Degree/Diploma in Computer Science or Engineering
  • 2 years’ experience using GCP cloud monitoring and logging
  • 1 year hands on experience with Looker development
  • At least 1+ years’ experience working with Big Query
  • At least 1+ years’ experience with CI/CD pipeline, can create Terraform scripts
  • Knowledge/experience working with Linux (Red Hat Enterprise/CentOS) and Windows, in a DevOps environment and Splunk
  • Knowledge of Agile, Test-Driven Development and Continuous Deployment

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Relational databases and SQL
  • Networking protocols
  • SDN technologies, virtualization environment and Docker containers
  • NiFi flow development
  • Redshift/ Snowflake

item.title: Solution Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 

What you’ll do     

 

  • Collaborate with both technology and business partners and domain architects in order to design robust enterprise grade solutions
  • Document various solution options and recommend the best approach balancing constraints and future needs
  • Propose solutions to enable business objectives while advancing enterprise tech strategies
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Participate in requirements review sessions or attend intake assessment meetings to estimate effort for high-level solutions
     

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are recognized for your 10+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You have an architecture level understanding of APIs, security architecture, and cloud native development on one of the major cloud providers (GCP, Azure, AWS)
  • You have experience with designing, developing, and operationalizing high-volume back-end web applications
  • You have experience with REST API design
  • You have strong proficiency with JavaScript and understand the nature of asynchronous programming

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • GCP experience and certification
  • Experienced in working with NodeJS

item.title: Manager-Technology Strategy - Wireless Core Network and Services DevOps
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

TELUS’ Wireless Core Network & Services Dev/Ops team is responsible architecture, deployment, optimization, and operations for technology platforms that support the national wireless core network. We have a unique opportunity for an engaging people leader to manage a software development team.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will lead a team of engineers and software developers to transform to virtualized network functions, softwarize network services, and improve service reliability across core platforms. The team will work with our industry partners, both telco vendors and hyperscalers, to develop and operate wireless services including but not limited to system integration, software development, data analytics and automation. Your management skills, industry knowledge and technological leadership will shape TELUS’ next-generation networks and services.  Moreover, your natural abilities to collaborate with other teams such as Product and Sales will set you apart.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Coach, develop and inspire a diverse team of DevOps professionals
  • Solve problems and handle escalation in a collaborative and effective manner 
  • Set key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure individual and team successes
  • Build trust and partnership with internal/external stakeholders and lead customers
  • Develop and operate software solutions based on virtualized infrastructure and 5G 
  • Focus on reliability across critical user journeys
  • Using Agile engineering principles, you will lead the efforts to quickly adapt to new technologies, services and applications
  • With a constant focus on customer experience and industry trends, you will lead on-going improvements to our core to ensure the best customer experience every time, everywhere
  • Manage platform lifecycles, 3-year service roadmap and Capex/Opex budgets
  • Adopt principals of Reliability by Design, Security by Design and Privacy by Design

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Respected as a collaborative partner and trusted advisor who builds strong relationships across the organization and providing value add
  • Regarded as an excellent communicator, negotiator and influencer, able to communicate complex ideas and concepts to a variety of audiences including senior leaders in a clear, simple, easy to understand manner
  • Recognized for your Customer First mindset and delivering on optimal outcomes for both internal and external stakeholders
  • Sought out for your strategic thinking, business acumen, sound decision making and result-driven mindset with the ability to take initiative and ownership of complex issues through to resolution
  • Solid knowledge and understanding of:
    • Application integration models and methodologies
    • Agile development and DevOps methodologies
    • Application Development environments and technologies for delivering digital solutions
    • Software development and coding techniques 
    • Cloud native technologies and concepts
  • Proven business, financial and strategic skills with experience in assessing alternatives and business case development
  • Noted to have a high degree of curiosity, continuously learning new topics, concepts and technologies, and also looking beyond the surface level to understand the full picture and questioning/challenge the status-quo resulting to drive higher business value
  • Respected for your advanced knowledge of 3GPP (IMS/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) wireless core networks optimization and performance
  • Ability to interact with technical team members and distill complex ambiguous problems into actionable items
  • Experience negotiating with vendors for new technology and support agreements
  • Broad base of knowledge across IT and Network systems, support and processes
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field and/or relevant experience

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Big data correlation and machine learning knowledge
  • Experience in web/mobile applications development
  • Master of Engineering degree and/or MBA

item.title: Splunk/New Relic Developer
item.description:
Description


Join our team

 

With the convergence of innovative home and mobile networking technologies including fiber and 5G, smart home solutions, mobile devices, automation, cloud computing and over-the-top capabilities, our customers’ homes look very different in today’s digital world. Every day, TELUS’ engineering and development teams are envisioning what the future holds and building the technologies to simplify our customers’ lives, provide services at the touch of a button and create immersive entertainment experiences. ffhjobs

 

We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, and we are looking for Splunk/New Relic developers to join our team! We are responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions. As a Splunk/New Relic developer, you will help us drive a large scale digital transformation program. It’s an exciting time to be a part of our mission to drive better outcomes through customer-centric, state-of-the-art software platforms.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

  • Contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market
  • Unlock the power of cloud-native environments, having the freedom to leverage innovative technologies and the latest standards
  • Help drive a high-performance DevOps culture
  • Become a go-to expert on the code components you are responsible for and how they fit into the overall architecture, promoting a seamless solution
  • Power future possibilities for our customers and advance a compelling portfolio of technologies and services from consumer front ends, to streaming and content protection, to user entitlements and payments

 
Here\'s how

 

  • Provide day to day support for Splunk/New Relic environments and full system life cycle
  • Extensive working experience in creating and implementing dashboards
  • Analyze highly complex business requirements; generate technical specifications to design or redesign complex software components and applications
  • Act as a technical resource expert for modeling, simulation, and analysis efforts
  • Leverage industry best practices to design, test, implement and support the solution
  • Act as the Splunk/New Relic subject matter expert in providing technical leadership in the design, development and support, and other intelligence big data analytics industry initiatives
  • Use your experience to explore a variety of machine learning, statistical analytics, and data mining techniques to improve Corporate Security’s investigative capabilities using technology to support monitoring and digital fraud investigation needs
     

 

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge, training and/or certifications in Splunk Enterprise (installing, configuring, troubleshooting different Splunk components and building clusters; integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience and extensive working knowledge of New Relic (installing agents, configuring, troubleshooting different New Relic components; configuring API keys, integrating with external services; CI/CD deployment of elements and dashboards)
  • Extensive experience troubleshooting multi-layer frontend/backend systems.
  • Proficiency in Python, SPL language, XML, HTML, CSS, JSON, Excel
  • Solid understanding of SQL scripting for querying databases (MySQL, Postgresql, Cassandra, etc.)
  • 5 or more years of hands-on experience with Linux
  • 3 or more years of hands-on experience with Cloud technologies – GCP, AWS, or Azure
  • Deep knowledge of Kubernetes and underlying technologies
  • Must be self-motivated, energetic, and results-oriented and be committed to adding value to the organization
  • Highly flexible and able to adapt quickly to changing priorities

 

Great to Have

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
  • Deep knowledge of proxying and load balancing technologies such as HAProxy or NGINX
  • Experience in agile development practices including the ability to create CI/CD pipelines from scratch using tools such as: Jenkins, Gitlab and Github
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams and able to translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand business language
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity

item.title: Design Specialist (Cloud RAN Automation Technology and Performance)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The latest Open RAN (Radio Access Network) technology brings not only BBU (baseband unit) cloudifications & virtualization, open interfaces between DU (Distributed Unit) and RU(Radio Unit) , but also introduces and enables ORAN intelligent automation platform namely SMO (Service Management and Orchestration) with RIC (RAN intelligent Controller) which applies automation at scale to simplify the complexity of ORAN networks, as well as improve network performance, enhance customer experience and minimize ORAN operational costs with ORAN analytics and assurance. 

 

TELUS is forming a new Cloud RAN automation platform DevOps team which will oversee the development, operations and evolution of ORAN SMO and RIC architecture and technology. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth. We see great value in bringing Cloud, IP/MPLS, data analytics and software development professionals into this team in addition to RAN knowledge to not only develop these platforms but also enhance the systems to enable TELUS ORAN intelligent operations by closely working with TELUS Stakeholders, vendors and ORAN DevOps team.

 

What you’ll do

 

  • Be responsible for ORAN SMO (service management and orchestration) platform design and technology development, drive vendor’s SMO roadmap to align with TELUS’s ORAN automation strategies
  • Be responsible for ORAN RIC (RAN Intelligent Controller) platform design and technology development
  • Create ORAN automation policies & rules, templates & algorithms and workflow services for ORAN full stack automation, including vRAN Bare Metal, xHaul, CaaS, and vDU/vCU services. 
  • Develop O-Cloud (ORAN-Cloud) orchestration and federation solutions including ORAN IMS (Infrastructure Management Services) and DMS (Deployment management Services)
  • Responsible for ORAN Software and Hardware Life Cycle Management solution development and introduction
  • Lead the development of ORAN data processing workflow, as well as data pipelines system design and configurations to ensure data availability and integrity to end users
  • Define TELUS RIC model and algorithm standards for new xApp and rApp onboarding
  • Lead the integration with TELUS overarching remedy’s and systems
  • Drive Open SMO integration with TELUS’s selected vRAN solutions
  • Technology introduction of evolutionary ORAN OAM (FCAPS) via streaming telemetry
  • Lead SMO/RIC platform AI (Artificial Intelligent)/ML (Machine Learning) workflow services design and technology introduction

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • 5+ years of working experience on IP/MPLS and Kubernetes networking, familiar with associated protocols (VxLAN, Calico, CNI, M-LAG, EVPN etc.)
  • Experiences with LTE, 5G NSA (Non-stand alone) and SA (Standalone) RAN (Radio access network) technology
  • Expertise in one or more programming languages and data formats such as Java, Python, GO, XML, YAML, Shell Scripting, JSON, Restful APIs etc. 
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes services such as Google’s Kubernetes Engine (GKE), Amazon’s Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), RedHat OpenShift, WindRiver Cloud platform, Robin.io cloud platform
  • Experience on managing and developing cloud-native containerized micro services
  • Experience on Kubernete cloud analytics tools (i.e beats, logstash, elasticsearch, kibana, Kafka and/or Prometheus)
  • Experience on large scale Kubernetes cluster orchestration and federation solutions and tools, familiar with Windriver central cloud and conductor, or Openshift ACM, or Robin MDCAP is a big asset for successful candidate 
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • Proactive, can lead cross-team initiatives
  • A Bachelor or Master Degree in Electrical/computer engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • Experience in Requirements Engineering, Solution Architecture, Design, Development and Deployment Experience in Underlying infrastructure for Big Data Solutions (Clustered/Distributed Computing, Storage, Data Center Networking) 
  • Familiar with Open-RAN and ETSI specifications and standards
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Big Query, DataFlow etc.
  • Experience with AI/ML toolkits such as Tensor Flow, Mllib, H2Oai , Kubeflow etc

ORANJobs  *LI-hybrid *LI-remote

item.title: Senior Strategy Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


This is a dream job for the curious, analytical mind wanting to push the boundaries and challenge the status quo. You will be professionally rewarded by the diversity of problems and data sets, and with your expertise, provide discoveries that will solve complex challenges and opportunities that drive strategic business decisions to delivering optimum business outcomes, including capital deployment plans, and exceptional customers experiences. Additionally, you will develop appropriate data models and frameworks, drawing from various data sources, to support business investments and improved MCE reliability.
