Our team will formulate and facilitate strategies backed by data. You will use your past experiences to find data, analyze it for trends that support both short term tactics in support of strategies that may take years to achieve.

 

What you’ll do 


Reporting to the Director, Planning & Engineering with the Mission Critical Environments (MCE) team, you are responsible for leading the development and execution of MCE business and transformational programs, driving exemplary client experience and unit cost improvements.

 

You are a dynamic self-starter and thought leader with top-notch people skills and an analytical edge. You will create a consolidated business unit strategy across the MCE planning, operations, and build teams and lead the evolution / execution of multiple, high-priority business unit strategies and programs that will include executive updates via business case and presentations. You are MCE’s lead within the Reliability Leadership Team (RLT) delivering priority and reliability based capital funding requests.

 

You will develop the business unit and MCE capital strategy by:

 

  • Soliciting and consolidate inputs from various stakeholder teams to support the development of the MCE strategic plan, selected business planning roadmaps and issues and opportunities for improvement
  • Establish performance indicators that measure (metrics/KPIs) program success:
    • Develop, maintain and manage appropriate Scorecard (as a measure of success), including working with other relevant resources (x-functional SMEs, ops stakeholders) to define “success” for MCE programs, projects and initiatives
    • Ensure Scorecard Objectives are met – on time, on budget, in scope
    • Provide Executive level reporting
  • Building sound analytics and processes to support the improved understanding of all equipment failure rates and replacement options, including drawing conclusions and recommending proposals resulting from analysis
  • Solving diverse business problems in a data rich environment through data mining, predictive modeling, machine learning, statistics and other analytical techniques
  • Visualizing and reporting data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provides insights that will drive strategic business decisions
  • Supporting the development of the annual Strategy Check presentation and support of all yearly planning cycles
  • Lead multiple, large programs and support a high-performance, highly engaged cross-functional team responsible for executing on key cross-functional initiatives
  • Drive program execution against strategic, operational and financial objectives; own and deliver key tenants of MCE financial budget targets
  • Working within an agile/scrum environment
  • Fostering internal as well as external Partner and Client executive relationships

 

 

Qualification

 

What you bring

 

  • University degree (preferably in Engineering or Diploma in Engineering or Electronics plus experience in Statistic modeling)
  • 5 or more years of experience with data analytics experience covering large data volumes and complex data sets from varying sources
  • 5 or more years of experience within Network or IT operations
  • Knowledge or experience in strategic planning, business analysis and/or business systems analysis
  • Project management methodologies, principles and practices
  • Understanding of business drivers, customers and the links to IT strategies & priorities
  • Understanding of performance metrics development & analysis, process improvement or portfolio management
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to simplify the explanation of complex business challenges
  • Collaboration across all levels of the MCE team and with key stakeholders

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • Six Sigma – green belt

item.title: Performance Analyst II - Analysis & Reporting
item.description:
Description

 

Join Our Team

 

We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large segments. We are the forefront at our stakeholder to provide data and measurement support for various marketing activities supporting to achieve our bottom line success. 

 

If you have passion for growth, learning, data, and analytics and enjoy fast pace environment, come join our team to make a meaningful impact.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

You will be an integral part of the team and spearhead measurement aspect of medium and large scale of businesses and be hands on to build new solutions. You will work closely with marketing, base management, data science and BI team to build a solution which will have direct impact on providing intelligence on marketing activities 

 

You will work closely with martech team to implement new technologies and build strong foundation with appropriate solutions which will redefine how TELUS interacts with its customers

Here’s how

 

  • You will develop new measurement solutions to provide timely insights to the business
  • You will do various ETL process to assemble multiple data sources across various databases to build right solution
  • You will build and manage existing stored procedure to create appropriate measurement solution. 
  • You will implement business intelligence rules, optimize data processes and perform data quality audits
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders, help foster the relationships and lead data enablement programs
  • Effectively communicate with leadership and stakeholders providing them with regular updates on programs and new solutions 

 

 

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
 

  • You have experience spearheading large scale projects, defining business outcomes, managing stakeholder expectations, and partnering with multiple team members
  • You can manage ambiguity and change with a learning and growth mindset
  • You have advanced working knowledge of SQL and experience working with relational databases.
  • You have minimum 2+ years of experience in a similar role and/or related education with demonstrated performance

 

Great to haves

 

  • Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
  • Prior measurement & reporting experience

 

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Front End Developer - API Marketplace Portal
item.description:
Join our team


Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading-edge technologies. We hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s Top 100 Employer (2022) with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, and award-winning opportunities for career development.
 
The API Marketplace gives the ability to connect API consumers with API owners, enabling the creation of thousands of applications by TELUS teams and 3rd parties. Being able to support a broad range of applications from customer self-care to health to messaging to emergency response to fleet management to charitable giving and beyond, the API Marketplace plays a foundational role for TELUS to participate in the digital economy.

 
What you\'ll do
 

As a Senior React Developer, you will help drive the software development for our core network infrastructure and services. Your creativity coupled with strong software development, automation, data science, and computer networking skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building and maintaining our API gateway platform to a variety of types of services from network capabilities to health services to support existing mobility infrastructure and offer new services.
 
You will exercise your entrepreneurial spirit and creative vision to change the way TELUS leverages technology. Collectively, the passion we have to transform the Network landscape will remain a leading factor in why customers continue to recognize TELUS as the fastest and most reliable network in Canada.

 
Here’s how
 

  • Create new solutions while working as part of our existing Agile Development Team with a good focus on quality, automated testing and reliability
  • Develop quality solutions through adherence to coding standards and test automation.
  • Develop new features and implement design improvements 
  • Participate in creation of technical design documentation: Detail design & architecture documents
  • Participate in operational improvement initiatives, in conjunction with other technology teams in the company

What you bring

 

  • With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Valued for your 5+ years of relevant professional experience as a Senior React Developer with demonstrated experience guiding a team 
  • Skilled in software development/software engineering, process automation using programming/scripting languages
  • Working in collaborative agile development teams, with experience working with CI/CD pipelines and activities.
  • Known for your experience working on cloud computing platforms including AWS & GCP
  • Passionate about API design
  • Committed to building strong relationships with key stakeholders including senior management across the technology and partnering organizations


Great-to-haves
 

  • Java Experience
  • DevOps tools such as Ansible, Jenkins, GitLAB and Splunk


Note:  Can work remotely from any major Canadian city

item.title: Technical Product Manager
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

Our mission is to make life easier for our partners, our customers, and for our team. We’re looking for a Technical Product Owner to join our high-performing customer-centric wireless, IoT and TELUS Pay team. Our team is responsible for growing and managing wholesale wireless and IoT portfolios. We work with other large and small telecom companies and digital payment aggregators in providing best in class products and services.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

In this role, you will set the direction for our End-to-End partner and customer journey as part of the product/service development. You will own, help with the vision, strategic direction and roadmap for all digital asset development supporting our products. Working closely with partners across the organization, you’ll chart the path, deliver impact for customers, and launch new products.

 

Here\'s how

 

  • Working closely with the product team you will define a shared vision on the platforms and processes supporting our products 
  • Be a champion for vision and prioritization of digital experiences in partnership with partners to achieve the business outcomes (return on investment)
  • You will bring your technician knowledge to drive conversations with our technical teamWork with project managers and financial analysts to prepare a annual financial capital investment plan to win support in getting your programs funded
  • Establish relationships and liaise with a diverse group of cross-functional partners within the organization; collaborate on interdependent roadmaps and technology investments to achieve mutual business outcomes
  • Build organizational support and the understanding of the strategic direction of the product
  • Define tangible product roadmap - actively own and be responsible for the product backlog and prioritize based on feedback and value
  • Accountable for critical product metrics and to report progress, provide ongoing communication to partners on progress
  • Balance expectations and remove business and roadmap impediments
  • Own product research and measurements, drive optimizations
  • Accountable for the overall product health (security, accessibility, performance and more)

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • Has 2-5 years of experience working on complex multi-year digital products with agile delivery
  • Theorizing ideas for process improvement and implements the change
  • Shows good ability to use 1 or more planning tools, e.g. JIRA
  • Has the ability to track time and cost against an agreed baseline and provide an early warning of likely deviation
  • Responsible for ensuring projects are delivered to budget and schedule
  • Noted for your expertise as a Product Owner in a digital team or company, including hands-on experience managing all stages of the product life cycle
  • With a strong foundation in and knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Known for your ability to work in a highly-collaborative, cross-functional setting, with an ability to co-create, execute, and foster trusted relationships with other teams to deliver customer value 

 
Great-to-haves

 

  • Knowledge of wireless network, architecture, 5G, IoT considered a strong asset
  • Building ECommerce experiences and experience with digital payments
  • Bachelor\'s degree in Information Technology (computer science, data sciences, or equivalent experience)
  • Previous technical experience or software development experience 
  • Working directly with the Product Engineering team including outsourcing partners
  • Basic understanding of cloud and local APIs, interface agreements, etc

item.title: Cloud Data Architect
item.description:
Description


Join our team and what we\'ll accomplish together

 

The Data Enterprise Data Layer team designs, implements and oversees the GCP analytics platform at TELUS.  Known as the DataHub, our team architects and operationalizes the underlying infrastructure used to power data solutions that drive value and deliver results from analytics. Our platforms provide the organization with modern cloud native services, DataOps methodologies and processes, and a self-serve data environment to test & learn and productionalize data models enabling data driven decisions.  Our vision is to empower our TELUS business partners with a standardized platform utilizing infrastructure, policy and governance as code, setting guide rails for teams to develop their data & analytics use cases within our cloud data platform.

We are looking for technical enthusiasts who can help build our next generation solution.
Together we will build and enable best-in-class data platforms with a focus on expanding our capabilities while ensuring always available analytics in Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Use your analytical skills and ability to assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.


What you’ll do

 

  • Work with and listen to business and technical teams to understand their needs
  • Define the ideal cloud data architecture with a focus on self-serve, efficiency, security and privacy
  • Design and implement solutions that move us forward on our MLOPs, DevOps and infrastructure as code journey within GCP
  • Collaborate kindly and proactively with the rest of our team and our customers (internal teams at TELUS)
  • Implement best in class cloud architecture to solve business use cases from concept to production
  • Identify opportunities for automation and implement in the development and production process
  • Provision and maintain existing platforms to facilitate growth and stability
  • Author quality documentation for any solutions implemented on both how they were implemented and how to use them

Qualifications


What you bring

 

  • You are collaborative and able to work with various IT and business teams to deliver on outcomes 
  • You are able to share a vision and implement long-term data strategies while providing value early and often along the journey
  • You have in depth knowledge of data architecture both on premise and on GCP, AWS and / or Azure platforms and have demonstrated experience designing and implementing enterprise grade data environments
  • You have experience with cloud-native technologies, such as Terraform, Kubernetes, Composer and serverless computing
  • You have in depth experience with the flow of data between systems, cloud big data environments and tooling with applications such as BigQuery, Dataflow, BigTable, Data Catalog, CloudSQL, Vertex AI, Pub/Sub, Dataprep and Cloud Spanner
  • You can design and deploy distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems
  • You have experience with YAML and/or JSON for configuration
  • You can explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces, and APIs to senior leaders and business stakeholders
  • You understand that system stability drives availability and customer trust
  • You have demonstrated experience with Secure by Design and Zero Trust data architectures and are able to provision cloud infrastructure with best in class security
  • You have in depth knowledge of PII and privacy compliance and have demonstrated architectural design, system interactions and life cycle management that puts customer safety first
  • You are able to provide guidance to optimize data collection, storage, and consumption by choosing the right platforms and tools for the right use casesYou have good understanding of DevOps & DataOps principles and tools

 

Great-to-haves

 

 

  • Experience with Google’s BigQuery service
  • Experience with MLOPs methodologies and process
  • Data Warehousing and data modeling design experience
  • Experience with FinOps and Cloud platform budget management

item.title: Senior Design Specialist - 5G Capacity and Data Analytics
item.description:
Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join a team that is in the heart of the telecommunications revolution. Help us transform our network capacity planning processes to enter the 5G era.

 

Our team is responsible for the capacity planning of TELUS’ wireless network, this includes a broad range of data analytics and engineering activities, from projects that guide multi-year executive strategies to day-to-day network capacity planning to support the growing network traffic. You will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern engineering best practices, including automation and ML/AI, to build and evolve the Best Wireless Network.

 

As a 5G Capacity and Data Analytics Specialist, you’ll provide technical leadership to ensure we efficiently plan and deploy network capacity based on customer specific requirements. The role is an intersection between Network Performance, Business Requirements and Customer Experience.

 

Your creativity coupled with strong data analytics skills and RF Engineering will allow us to find the best ways of building our wireless 4G/5G networks to support existing and new services. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how best to address our evolving business challenges.

What you’ll do

 

  • By using modern data analytics and automation techniques, transform our capacity planning processes to enter the 5G service based era
  • By proactively defining novel capacity planning techniques/models for 5G/LTE use cases
  • By producing and managing the RAN network capacity plans for mobility and fixed wireless users
  • By collaborating with other technical and business teams to understand new technologies and services to make our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
  • By developing dashboards and data visualizations, you will provide insights into network capacity that can be shared with executives and peer groups
  • By monitoring network performance, you will identify actual capacity problems and predict future congestion issues in the network
  • By leading the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience

 

What you bring

 

  • Bachelor\'s degree in computer science, computer engineering or engineering
  • 7+ years of experience in mobile capacity planning and radio network design or optimization, and expertise in 5G and LTE technologies
  • Three to five years of experience in data analysis or software development
  • Proven ability to operate independently from general guidelines
  • Ability to refine (locally) or expand (nationally) analyzes based on a specific problem Ability to problem solve and make intuitive decisions using large data sets
  • Passion for data science, forecasting and using data visualization platforms like Splunk
  • Experience with SQL databases, understanding of NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk)
  • Python experience and basic knowledge of common data analysis libraries

 

Great to haves

 

  • Master\'s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
  • Experience with agile methodology and cloud services, preferably Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in deploying Node.js application, microservices or distributed systems

item.title: Business Consultant (Business Intelligence & Data Insights)
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

Join our fast paced team, and help us leverage your strong technical knowledge and business acumen to enable strategic data insights. The business intelligence outcomes we drive help our stakeholders and TBS leadership teams to make informed business decisions, gain deeper insights into key strategic programs, and help us understand the outcomes and consequences of competing priorities.

 

Within TELUS, our team is known as a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment and a great place to learn and develop. We have a culture of collaboration, recognition, and high-performance. Simply put, if you\'re bright, ambitious and eager for a challenge, this is the place to be!

 

You ideal profile includes

 

  • Deep understanding of business intelligence and analytics, including data engineering and managing data pipelines
  • Strong conceptual and analytical skills; able to work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Strong presentation skills, avid storyteller, communicator and collaborator; able to build relationships with audiences at all levels including senior leadership
  • Strong PLSQL skills, Python, Google Cloud Platform, Big Query, Spark, Tableau, ETL Tools, etc
  • An eagerness to learn, grow, and adapt to new software tools and business needs on an ongoing basis
  • Ability to manage projects from infancy to completion

 

 

Qualifications

 

What you bring

 

  • A high degree of emotional intelligence, interpersonal skills and thought leadership
  • Ability to produce efficient, clean and accurate content
  • Experience working with urgent and highly visible content
  • Self-organization and ability to manage multiple timelines and requirements
  • Excellent collaborative skills, with a proven track record of working with cross-functional teams such as Finance, Marketing, Product, and Operations 
  • Comfort working with all levels of the organization – from managers to senior executives
  • Ongoing desire to be part of a high paced, collaborative and exciting team focused on long term planning and business governance
  • A natural ability to form strong working relationships and transform the complicated into the simple
  • A high level of proficiency with Google Suite (especially Slides,Docs, Sheets) and storyboarding; you are able to deliver content tailored for the variety of audiences and forums you support


Great to haves

 

  • Knowledge of TELUS networks and systems
  • GCP certification
  • University degree and/or 5-6 years of equivalent combination of experience and education
  • Fundamental understanding of Data Science techniques and its strategic impact to business #LI-Remote #LI-HYBRID

item.title: Mechanical Designer Intern
item.description:
Description

Position:              Mechanical Designer Intern           
Location:             Kitchener, Ontario     
Duration:              Winter 2023
Area of Study:    Mechanical/Mechatronics/System Design/Electrical Engineering
Division:             OTTO Motors

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You\'re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a young company in this high-growth market. You have skills and experience that you know can make a difference with the Clearpath team, whether we\'re looking for them or not. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Most of all, you want to be on the right side during the coming robot revolution.

Job Responsibilities:

You will support the design, verification and upkeep of our robots\' mechanical systems. Your tasks could range from performing field testing of our newest generation of unmanned surface vehicle to designing structural components for an off-road ground vehicle. You may be required to take robots for walks, and are able to cope with the questioning stares of onlookers.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Prototyping of new electromechanical systems.
  • Test plan development and implementation.
  • Modeling, drafting and specification of custom parts and assemblies.
  • Sourcing and qualification of new mechanical components and systems.
  • Pushing our robots to their breaking points.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Capable hands-on skills. You are able to turn a car into a boat if necessary.
  • Excellent communication skills with proven ability to work with interdisciplinary teams.
  • Team player, good communicator, able to cope with sarcasm.
  • Able to cope with sudden jarring changes in projects, priorities, and the local gravity field.
  • Past experience with building robots or other vehicles which are larger than a breadbox.
  • SolidWorks modeling and drafting experience.
  • Experience having parts manufactured to your specifications.

Helpful

  • Familiarity with Linux, C, Python, ROS.
  • Experience with common sensors and actuators used for robotics.
  • Experience with the control of mobile robots.
  • Machine shop experience.
  • Experience with sheet metal parts.

item.title: Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:  Perception Autonomy Developer Co-op
Location:  Kitchener, Ontario    
Duration: Winter 2023        
Study Level: Senior 
Area of study: Computer Science/ Software Engineering, or similar  

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research products and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Autonomy Developer you will work on the testing and development of core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, computer vision, machine learning, target tracking and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new perception algorithms and sensing technology
  • Design and implement new perception systems and algorithms
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaboration with internal teams including the Simulation Team and Navigation Team
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in the field

Required Skills:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, target detection and tracking, robotic perception
  • Strong software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, TensorFlow, Gazebo, and PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git or other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

Description

Location: Kitchener, Ontario
Duration: Winter 2023
Student Level: Intermediate
Education: Computer Science/Software Engineering

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Software Developer Co-op to join the Fleet Core team.

The Fleet Core team is responsible for the design, integration, and evolution of Clearpath\'s fleet management and related system software. Your goal is to assist the team in building a system of robust and efficient software that can be deployed or upgraded by hundreds of integrator partners across the globe with the minimum of fuss.

You will be working with the Fleet Core team to migrate its WebSocket software to a new architecture. This work will involve building upon the currently migrated infrastructure, implementing and testing at scale the newly migrated software.

About You

You\'re excited about the role that robots will play in the future, and intrigued by the challenge of joining a fast-paced growing company. You are driven, view co-op as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop and migrate software for the OTTO Fleet Manager Websocket server’s new architecture
  • Test plan development and implementation, for functionality and stability at scale
  • Preparation and presentation of design documentation
  • Develop and show demonstration of work to the team
  • Contribute to design and code reviews

Skills/Requirements:

  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and manage deadlines
  • Enjoy being challenged and getting engaged with software development projects
  • Practical software development skills
  • Team player, good communicator
  • Familiarity with developing software in Linux
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Good understanding of object-oriented design principles

Bonus points for:

  • Experience writing unit tests

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. About the job:

You will be joining the OS (Operating Systems) team responsible for bridging the gap between the mechanical machine, the autonomy stack and the fleet manager. In this team, you will have the opportunity to experience a very broad software stack ranging from middleware software applications to very high-level server functionality.

Your primary responsibility will be to tackle hard problems and have the opportunity to show your skills in a team of highly competent developers. To be successful, you will need to know the basics of coding in C++ and Python, and bonus points if you know ROS as well. You will also need to be able to understand enough of a complicated system that is a self-driving robot and figure out what you need to do to complete your tasks. You will need to be able to make progress independently as well as leverage your team’s knowledge to be most efficient. You’ll have the opportunity to test and validate your solutions on our fleet of test robots.

Additional tasks may include:

  • Troubleshoot, address and validate issues.
  • Enhance existing components with new functionality.
  • Work collaboratively with a senior developer on a larger project.

Required Skills:

  • Experience with Linux.
  • Version control (Git).

Helpful:

item.title: Web Applications Developer Co-op
item.description:
Description

Position:              Web Applications Developer Co-op
Location:             Kitchener, Ontario              
Duration:             Winter 2023
Student Level:    Junior / Intermediate
Education:          Computer Science/Computer Engineering/Software Engineering 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit https://ottomotors.com

About the Job:

The OTTO Motors branch of Clearpath is looking for a software developer/engineering co-op to join the Fleet Application team.

In Fleet Applications, we are responsible for the design, development, and support of software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development, and support.

For this role, we are seeking an individual to help us extend and harden our NodeJS based authentication system that is used to manage user access to our robot fleet management system. You would be working closely with our UX specialists, Fleet test team and application developers to implement robust and maintainable web services and user interfaces that allow configuring and interacting with the authentication system .

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Adding new and updating existing capabilities of our existing NodeJS based authentication services
  • Implementing new and updating existing React based user interfaces for configuring the authentication system
  • Ensuring components are responsive, robust, and performant.
  • Creating new automated tests
  • Working with UX and other applications developers to brainstorm new patterns and methodologies for solving usability needs

About You:

You see the potential in intelligent robotics to change the world, and you want a career where you’ll get to make this happen personally. You want to work for a technology company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You like being the go-to person for technical questions. You are motivated by creating solutions for users that they find delight in using, and find pride and joy in building interfaces that are polished, flexible and easy to use.

Skills and experience:

  • Experience writing NodeJS web services, leveraging modules such as Express or Koa.
  • Familiar with simple databases and leveraging them from NodeJS
  • Experience using ReactJS for creating web applications
  • Proficient writing efficient and robust HTML5 / ES6 / CSS
  • Building user interfaces to align with provided designs and patterns
  • Experience implementing responsive styling for a variety of form factors
  • Understanding of using web application build tools (for example, webpack, babel, npm)
  • Familiar with source control, work management systems (for example, Jira), and creating functional documentation

Bonus Points For:

  • Comfortable using Ubuntu and shell terminals
  • Familiar with existing authentication libraries and protocols and how they are used
  • Experience with git and continuous integration tools such as Jenkins
  • Writing mobile based applications with touch interfaces

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Electrical Technologist
item.description:
Description

Position: Electrical Technologist  

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years of relevant experience with robot deployment

Education: Technical diploma in Electrical Engineering or Electrician certification or equivalent

Division: OTTO Motors

 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

You will be responsible for working with members of OTTO Motors’ electrical product team as we develop new vehicles for our expanding fleet. You will work with our Electrical Engineering team to develop electrical systems, help build the robots from the ground up,  repair robots, as well as maintain test equipment, and instrumentation. You will also help us continue to increase our test coverage and assist with engineering-led testing and service at client facilities. Finally, you will work with key members of the wider company to transition our work to the broader organization, including Testing, Quality, Production, Client Success, Professional Services, and other groups.

 

Primary responsibilities include:

  • On-the-fly wiring, assembly, and modification of a small quantity of large vehicles
  • Assist Electrical Engineers during verification and test procedures
  • Development of testing and documentation for vehicles and subsystems. 
  • Repair or replace various subsystems of the robot as needed.
  • Keeping engineering’s test/build facilities organized and maintained.

 

Additional tasks:

  • Any other design or development work which needs to be done which you are capable of.
  • Assisting the project team with initial test deployments
  • Support of initial systems alongside the rest of the project team
  • Support debugging of issues from harnesses, PCBA, or PLC

 

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

 

Required skills:

  • Possess skills in reading and interpreting technical drawings, electrical schematics prints, electrical and harness drawings. 
  • Experience in building and installing electrical harnesses and cables, connector and component selection, systems wiring. 
  • Has already encountered robots breaking in unpredictable ways at the worst possible times
  • Experience with getting technical multi-discipline tasks done quickly
  • Comfortable working in small groups with minimal oversight
  • Working knowledge in relation to safety when working with electrical and electronic equipment. 

 

Bonus points for one or more of the following:

  • Experience with Vesys and/or Altium
  • Electrical panel build experience is considered an asset.
  • Good attention to detail, organization, and time management skills.
  • Familiar with CSA/UL, NFPA and IPC Standards
  • Knowledge of PLCs
  • Past experience learning from development projects that have gone wrong
  • Basic ROS experience

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Hardware Designer
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:       Hardware Designer

Location:      Waterloo, Ontario             

Experience:     3+ Years relevant experience

Education:    Degree/Diploma in Electrical Engineering or Equivalent Experience

Division:       Clearpath Robotics

 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.


About the Job

We’re shipping more and more robots and seeing new uses for our products emerge every day!  We need an Embedded Electronics Design Engineer to help us take our innovative designs from napkin sketches to hundreds of pounds of precisely moving parts and facilitate every step in between. You will be responsible for the electronics designs of existing and new research industrial robotics products.  This will range through the entire design process from initial concept design and cost forecasting through to detailed design, validation, and final release to production.  Design challenges will span from high-level system architecture and power distribution to board layout and field testing.

 

Our hardware must be many things, but reliability is paramount. It will be your job to build systems that can operate in whatever environment we subject them to, all while keeping the motors turning for our mechanical team and the 1’s and 0’s flowing properly for our software developers. 

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Leading electronics design in standard products and custom development projects with a cross-functional team while ensuring that the project is on time and within budget
  • Developing circuits, layouts, and qualification plans for multi-layer PCB designs
  • Specifying and sourcing new board-level and system components, communicating with suppliers as needed
  • Performing system level electrical integration and testing in robotics platforms, including cable assembly design and prototyping
  • Debugging electronics within complex mobile robots and manipulation systems, then driving design revisions to resolve issues
  • Working with manufacturing personnel and vendors to create PCB stack-ups and bill of materials
  • Supporting the electrical systems of standard products of various lifecycle stages 

 

Additional tasks may include:

  • Designing power distribution, battery implementation and motor systems
  • Designing and building cable harnesses, busbars, developing cable management strategies, testing integrated systems, and working in close collaboration with Mechanical Designers and Software Developers
  • Collaborating with our Client Success team to support our customers
  • Supporting the evaluation of existing and new suppliers
  • Participating in certification and compliance reviews
  • Mentoring junior staff, technicians and co-op students
  • Evaluating how we can apply lessons-learned from other industries to our designs
  • Supporting on-site installation and commissioning of robotics equipment at customer facilities; occasional travel may be required (after COVID)

 

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

 

Required Experience/Skills:

  • Electronics and system level hardware design, including PCB designs involving embedded processors or microcontrollers (preferably STM32)
  • Schematic capture, layout, component libraries development, and bill of material creation using an ECAD tool, preferably Altium Designer
  • Knowledge of communications architectures including ethernet, USB, CAN bus, RS422/485 and I2C
  • Electronic component selection and validation
  • Cable assembly design
  • Debugging of electronics and system level issues using modern lab equipment including high speed oscilloscopes, bus analyzers, logic analyzers, etc.
  • Excellent technical documentation skills
  • Accepting responsibility for your designs in the complete lifecycle from concept to customer
  • Getting your hands dirty and working with your designs: soldering, building cables, building prototype systems, field testing, etc
  • Excellent organizational skills

 

Bonus points for:

  • Working with interdisciplinary teams to optimize product designs
  • Experience with high layer count board designs
  • Strong knowledge of EMC management principles and best practice design for EMI control, in-depth knowledge of PCB design and PCB technology
  • Knowledge about electronics manufacturing and DFM best practices
  • Experience working with high-power battery systems
  • Mechanical / electro-mechanical design experience or aptitude
  • Motor controller design and implementation experience
  • Power electronics and SMPS design experience
  • Experience with sensor selection and integration (proximity, LIDAR, cameras, etc)
  • Experience with Altium and Solidworks
  • Robotics interest or experience
  • Industrial safety system design and FMEA 
  • Standards and/or certification authority experience (UL, CSA, CE, FCC, ESA and NEC)

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Primary responsibilities include:

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

item.title: Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer
item.description:
Description

Position: Robot Platform Software Developer/Engineer

Location: Kitchener, Ontario

Experience: 3+ years

Education: Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics, Systems, Electrical Engineering, or a related field

Division: OTTO Motors

 

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job

The Platform team is responsible for integrating Hardware and Software on the OTTO Mobile Autonomous Robot platforms.  You are a true Mechatronics engineer, with a focus primarily on the software side of things including bare metal firmware, device drivers for external components, and application layer components. You will lead in developing the software components to make our robots function, and easily diagnose issues. You will exemplify a proper Software Development Life Cycle from beginning to end and contribute to every aspect of it. Your code will ultimately run on the robots and control mission-critical functionality such as battery management, sensor drivers or motor command output. Any failure could have catastrophic consequences. 

You will be involved with the initial proof of concept and bring-up of new robot hardware platforms, integrating the hardware with the autonomous software.  You will be responsible for the controls system architecture and design of new and existing industrial self-driving vehicles.  Design challenges will span from high-level system architecture, integration, programming, and field testing. You have no problem deducing hardware issues from software logs. You will need to be aware of functional safety implications in an industrial environment, and how to implement and verify safety functions. 

 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Architect, design and implement custom software, ranging from low-level robot control firmware, PC drivers for external controllers, and enhanced interactive diagnostics using C/C++ and Python
  • Prototyping and Bring-up of new Mechatronic platforms
  • Integrating complex electronics and control systems with Autonomous Software
  • Documentation of system-level architectures, and contributing to knowledge bases for triaging and debugging complex issues
  • Providing expert level debugging of our robots to support Client Success, Field Services, and internal Test and Manufacturing teams

 

Required Skills:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Mechatronics engineering, Systems, Electrical Engineering, or a related field with applicable background
  • 3+ years of experience working with C++ and/or Python
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Strong electronics and mechatronics prototyping and debugging skills (breadboarding, oscilloscopes, multimeters)
  • Experience of hands-on troubleshooting of electronic and electromechanical systems
  • Understanding of sensors and actuators and their error modes, especially motor controllers
  • Able to perform root-cause analysis of hardware and software issues from data logs
  • Familiarity with Linux (Debian based distributions)
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop software development plans, including timelines and test procedures
  • Past experience participating in development or deployment projects that have gone terribly wrong

 

Bonus Skills:

  • P.Eng Accreditation attained or in-progress

 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Senior Controls Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:           Senior Controls Software Developer/Engineer

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario

Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience

Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience

Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We’re shipping more and more robots and seeing new uses for our products emerge every day!  We need an experienced Industrial Controls Engineer to help us take our innovative designs from napkin sketches to hundreds of pounds of precisely moving parts and facilitate every step in-between.

You will be responsible for the industrial controls system designs of existing and new industrial autonomous mobile robots.  This will range through the entire design process from initial concepting, requirements engineering, and cost forecasting, through to detailed design, verification and validation, and final release to production.  Design challenges will span across high-level system architecture, integration, programming, and field testing.

You will be responsible for significant portions of the controls and safety systems design and implementation for our new and existing products.  Our systems must be many things, but reliability is paramount. It will be your job to design and prototype control systems architectures which can operate in whatever environments and with whatever jobs we subject them to.

You will be a pioneer for new robot technologies at Clearpath leveraging both off-the-shelf and bespoke components. Sometimes those challenges will be “Can we do it?”, but other times those challenges will be “How do we do this right?”. All this will get us towards many new kinds of robots faster!

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Architecture and design of Industrial control systems, especially their software, to be compliant with relevant standards such as ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • PLC and other industrial devices programming
  • First level of triage of problems to determine the root cause of complex mechatronic systems
  • Verifying and troubleshooting robot issues from software logs
  • Write and execute validation and test plans for PLC and safety functionality
  • Reviewing and releasing the configurations and firmware of various industrial devices
  • Contribute to component selection and evaluation 
  • New vehicle and controller bring-up, and prototype assembly
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, internal troubleshooting guides, etc)
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Additional tasks may include:

  • JIRA project task management
  • Robot configuration in a Linux environment
  • Supporting on-site troubleshooting and commissioning of prototype robotic vehicles at customer facilities. Occasional travel may be required (less than 5%)
  • Supporting product management with technical insight
  • Discovering and evaluating new technologies
  • Participating in productive technical planning sessions, both internally and with partner/client involvement
  • Support risk assessment and FMEDA activities

About You

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven and view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have common sense to back it up.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • 5+ years relevant work experience
  • Degree/diploma in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable experience
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision while managing deadlines
  • Experience working with industrial automation systems in safety critical applications
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of mechatronic systems
  • Advanced PLC programming and troubleshooting, preferably with Siemens automation controllers and tools 
  • Familiarity with industrial fieldbus and network protocols, such as CAN, ModbusTCP, Profinet/Profisafe, etc.
  • Familiarity with Linux (Ubuntu) operating systems and basic command line interactions
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Past experience participating in development or deployment projects that have gone terribly wrong
  • Able to cope with sudden jarring changes in projects, priorities, and the local gravity field.

Bonus points for:

  • IT experience in networking, OS configuration and troubleshooting, drivers
  • Experience with industrial electrical design and troubleshooting
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • PLC development for serial OEM machines and equipment
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles, such as AGVs, AMRs, SDVs, forklifts, tuggers etc.
  • Experience with ROS (Robot Operating System)
  • Software development using Python or C++
  • Familiarity with software version control and CI/CD tools, such as Git, Jenkins and Gitlab

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Financial Analyst / Business Analyst
item.description:
Description

Position:          Financial Analyst / Business Analyst

Location:          Kitchener, Ontario            

Experience:      3+ Years relevant experience

Education:       CPA Candidate, BBA or Masters of Accounting

Posting Both Clearpath and OTTO websites

 

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.and 

Clearpath Robotics Inc. (“Clearpath”) develops the future of robotics technology through industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath is an award-winning company - including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers. 

 

About OTTO™ Motors

OTTO™ Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics,  is making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through research and development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Finance Team

We are growing again and looking to add to our Team!  If you are aspiring to be a Financial Analyst / Business Analyst who thrives in a fast paced environment - we would like to help you grow in your career.  

Our track record for promoting from within and supporting individuals to reach their goals is part of what we do.  Reporting to the Director, Finance collaborating with the Finance and Operational Teams will provide you the opportunity to be an integral part of our business and the support to be an effective leader.       

About the Job - Primary Objectives

The ideal candidate is a person passionate about process, productivity and efficiency within a business - if that is you - this is the opportunity to develop seamless systems.  In addition to working closely with the Director, Finance and CFO to implement Finance and Operational initiatives, the Financial Analyst / Business Analyst will be responsible to work closely with our ERP Consultant to support the integration of the core ERP system and other ancillary software i.e. Salesforce, Bamboo HR, and other leading edge software.

 

You will have plenty of opportunities to collaborate with, and provide business decision support.  In addition, the position is responsible to:

  • Facilitate financial support of strategic projects 
  • Working collaboratively with the CFO, Director, Finance and Controller to implement digitization initiatives expanding the capacity and capabilities of the company, its divisions and the Finance Team
  • Strengthen the financial well-being of the Company by documenting systems that capture and build upon knowledge and follow good governance practices
  • Support risk mitigation strategies with the CFO and Commercial Contracts Manager

Strategy

  • Share analysis and recommendations to improve financial performance of the company 

 

Accounting and Reporting

  • Reconcile assigned general ledger accounts monthly and provide associated reporting and insights
  • Assist with the tracking and reporting of the Company’s employee stock option plan.
  • Assist with preparation of internal management accounting reports, external financial statements and reports as well as financial and other information for income tax reporting purposes.

Other Assignments 

  • Coach and develop Operational Teams to build ERP and system and financial knowledge and capabilities
  • Automate financing partners requests for information and reporting
  • Build virtual data rooms to support business grant and loan opportunities - collate grant application information and prepare periodic reports.
  • Implement system internal controls recommendations, ASPE compliance and applicable federal, provincial and local regulatory laws and rules
  • Contribute to the periodic and year end audits with the Finance Team and auditors.
  • Validate timecard data capture to support SR&ED claims 

Key Requirements

  • 5+ years experience in public accounting or high technology or manufacturing industry
  • BA in Accounting or Finance, CGA, CMA or CPA designation an asset
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization
  • Strong problem solving and creative skills and the ability to exercise sound judgment and make decisions based on accurate and timely analyses. 
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results-orientation.
  • High level of proficiency with software including ERP systems, Google Suite and Microsoft Office Word and Excel
  • Self motivated, highly organized and ability to work independently
  • Attention to detail but can see the big picture

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863

item.title: Robot Builder
item.description:
Description

About Clearpath Robotics Inc.

Clearpath Robotics Inc. develops the future of robotics technology through development and sale of industry-leading self-driving technology, products, and services to over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands. Proprietary hardware, software, and services are delivered through the company’s research and industrial divisions: Clearpath Robotics and OTTO™ Motors. Clearpath Robotics Inc. is an award-winning company with recent awards including Robotics Business Review Top 50 Robotics Company, Edison Award for Innovation, Business Insider Top 40 under 40, and Canada’s Top 100 Employers.

About the Job:

We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We require a handy individual to take charge of assembling a variety of different platforms and ensuring that we perpetually strive for a higher level of quality. We need a Robot Builder to take responsibility in assembling our core products along with their accessories.

You will contribute to a team dedicated to seeing a robotic platform from start to finish. Additionally, when you are not wrenchin’ down screws, you will be tasked with maintaining the organization and cleanliness of the production area.

This position requires the worker to be on site for the full daily shift. There is no opportunity to work from home. 

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Electromechanical Assembly of robotic platforms 
    • Use of hand tools
    • Use of hoisting equipment
    • Cable installation and wire routing
  • Rotating throughout different assembly stations to achieve cross-training among team members
  • Ensuring your workspace follows 5S guidelines
  • Using a computer for work instructions via VKS system
  • Production area maintenance
  • Production equipment maintenance
  • Other duties as assigned

About You:

You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%.  You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  

Required Skills:

  • Experience working on manual product assembly
  • Wiring or cable installation experience preferred
  • Hands-on experience with common tools, eg, screwdriver, hammer, and electric drills.
  • Practical knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel and GSuite
  • Able to work the Day shift Hours 7am - 3pm Monday to Friday
  • Positive and professional attitude with safety mindset
  • Proven ability to work independently
  • Experience working with ERP systems is an asset.
  • Ability to follow written assembly work instructions in English
  • Comfortable with abrupt changes to project deadlines.
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs comfortably 

Bonus points for:

  • Hobbies that involve working with power tools, woodworking for instance
  • Hobbies that involve assembly with hand tools, car maintenance for instance
  • Lean manufacturing experience
  • Continuous Improvement Process
  • 5S methodology
  • Previously being part of a Health & Safety Committee

What’s in it for you:

  • Work life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Corporate discounts and Group Insurance (home and auto)
  • Free snacks to keep you energized during the shift!
  • Cool company events such as BBQs and other celebrations including occasional food trucks at the facilities
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Friendly and fun co-workers!

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Marketing Manager (Fixed-Term Contract)
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position:             Marketing Manager (12-Month Fixed Term Contract)

Location:            Waterloo, Ontario

Experience:        5+ years relevant experience in Marketing

Education:          BSc/BA or diploma in marketing, business, communications, or equivalent

 

About Clearpath Robotics Research Solutions

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.


About the Job:

In your role as Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing, planning and implementing marketing initiatives that promote brand awareness, engage the robotics research and development community and drive demand for Clearpath robotic platforms, autonomy software and services.  The ideal candidate will have passion for technology and working collaboratively across the organization to achieve common goals.  


Responsibilities include:

  • Generate new business opportunities through targeted, multi-faceted marketing tactics and campaigns
  • Own the overall marketing strategy and oversee the planning, development and implementation of marketing programs, campaigns and initiatives. 
  • Manage the inbound marketing and content marketing strategy including the ideation, planning, development and implementation of online marketing content including videos, blog posts, white papers, webinars, podcasts & more.
  • Manage the development and dissemination of sales and marketing collateral, media and other digital assets.  
  • Manage the events marketing strategy including the planning, coordination and attendance of industry conferences and trade shows. 
  • Manage the digital marketing strategy including overseeing social media accounts, lead nurturing campaigns,  company newsletter and websites to engage customers, prospects and the overall robotics community. 
  • Collaborate with strategic partners and Value Added Resellers (VARs) on joint marketing campaigns and initiatives.  
  • Gather customer and market insights to inform outreach strategies, increase customer conversions, and generate more qualified leads.
  • Identify effectiveness and impact of current marketing initiatives with tracking and analysis, and optimize accordingly.
  • Present ideas and final deliverables to internal and external teams, and communicate with senior leaders about marketing programs, strategies, and budgets
  • Manage and administer marketing tools and tech stack including Hootsuite, Pardot, Salesforce and Vidyard.
  • Work closely with agencies, and cross-functional teams in the creation of communication ideas, plans and tactics. 
  • Lead, inspire and collaborate with marketing team 
  • Project management, budget management and scheduling.

About you:

You want to work for a company with a vision to impact the world.  You are a leader and natural collaborator - a highly driven, high energy person that views work as more than just a job. You’re a big-picture thinker that possesses a unique blend of both business and technical savvy.  You are never satisfied with a project left half-done and want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. 


You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  Oh, and you have some combination of experience, higher education, and common sense to back it up.


Marketers come from various backgrounds, therefore, most importantly we are looking for someone who matches the description above and is looking to take on the world.  That being said we consider these baseline for our next team member:

  • 5+ years direct marketing management experience
  • Business, Marketing, or Creative background
  • A proven track record of launching great products
  • Unusually great organizational and time management skills
  • Excellent in both verbal and visual communication
  • Collaborative to your core
  • Strong B2B marketing experience
  • Experience marketing software to the industrial space

Bonus points for:

  • Experience building robots, self-driving vehicles, or cloud based software
  • Previous experience introducing disruptive technology to the market
  • Adobe Creative Suite experience 

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.
