item.title: Technical Solutions Developer, Elastifile, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-05-24T21:02:16.297Z

Technical Solutions Developer, Elastifile, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in a technical field or equivalent practical experience in technical support/professional services/software development/product operations management.
  • Experience with reading/debugging in one or more of the following: Java, C, C++, .NET, Python, Shell, Perl, and/or JavaScript.
  • Experience with troubleshooting and advocating for customers\' needs.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with cloud-based serverless, storage, and developer tools technologies.
  • Experience with distributed data processing frameworks or distributed, columnar, and/or analytic-related databases.
  • Experience with open source distributed storage and processing utilities within Apache Hadoop and/or workflow orchestration products such as Apache Airflow.
  • Experience in data analytics, data science, warehousing, extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) development, or other Big Data applications.
  • Knowledge of web technologies, TCP/IP concepts, and Unix/Linux basic administration and commands.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Technical Solutions Developer, you will troubleshoot technical challenges for customers by debugging, networking, performing system administration, updating documentation, and coding/scripting. You will make our products easier to adopt and to use by making improvements to the product, tools, processes, and documentation. In addition, you\'ll help drive the business growth of Google Cloud by recognizing and advocating for customers’ challenges.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Manage customer issues through effective diagnosis, resolution, or implementation of investigation tools to increase productivity for customers on Google Cloud Platform products.
  • Develop knowledge of Google\'s product technology and underlying architectures by troubleshooting, reproducing, determining the root cause for customer reported challenges, and building tools for faster diagnosis.
  • Act as a consultant for internal stakeholders in Development, Sales, and customer organizations to resolve potential technical deployment obstacles and improve Google Cloud.
  • Identify customer challenges and advocate for needs with cross-functional teams (i.e., Product Management or Software Development).
  • Work as part of a team of Developers and Consultants that globally ensure customer support.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

item.title: UX Design Manager, Cloud AI and Industry Solutions
item.description:
2022-04-29T17:32:06.793Z

UX Design Manager, Cloud AI and Industry Solutions

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • 12 years of experience in UX Design.
  • 3 years of experience in managing or leading design teams.
  • A portfolio of UX-focused work samples for web and mobile application.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience building solutions that are comprised of many products and services.
  • Experience with Command Line Interfaces/API design and/or developer tools.
  • Experience establishing Accessibility focus for products.
  • Ability to communicate complex interaction concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and analytical skills.
  • A passion for design in enterprise healthcare, cloud, or data warehousing and analytics products.

About the job

The Google Cloud Healthcare and Life Sciences (HCLS) team helps healthcare and life sciences customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers, infrastructure, and software. As a UX Design Manager, you will help shape the future of healthcare and life sciences related businesses and research organizations.

In this role, you will lead a group of established UX Designers across multiple Cloud Healthcare products/solutions to help scale growth and impact. You will help the team define experiences for strategic initiatives to bring Cloud, analytics, and AI technology to the industry’s most challenging problems. You will focus on transforming complex data ingestion, harmonization, storage, security, analysis, AI/ML, and visualization needs into effective and efficient user experiences. You will help build products and solutions that support a wide variety of end-users in the healthcare and life sciences space, including developers, data analysts, researchers, healthcare providers, patients, and more.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Foster Google’s culture and principles within the UX team, while working with the UX Research Manager and UX Program Manager to set standards in executional and operational excellence.
  • Work with UX Designers to prioritize workstreams, establish excellent OKRs, and communicate commitments to cross-functional product and engineering teams.
  • Provide leadership, direction, and mentorship for a team of designers across multiple products/solutions. Work with the team to drive strategic alignment across Cloud Healthcare and Life Sciences products and identify opportunities for product alignment opportunities across the Cloud AI and Industry Solutions organization.
  • Build excellent relationships with leaders to efficiently implement user experiences that are cohesive, inclusive, and well-informed.

item.description:

  • Verily Life Sciences
  • In-office:
    South San Francisco, CA, USA
  • + 6 more locations

Apply to this job on the Verily Life Sciences career site at Verily Careers.


Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: South San Francisco, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; Waterloo, ON, Canada; Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel; Haifa, Israel; Boston, MA, USA; Dallas, TX, USA.

About the job

Verily, an Alphabet company, lives at the intersection of technology, data science and healthcare. Our mission is to make the world’s health data useful so that people enjoy longer and healthier lives. We are developing tools and devices to collect, organize and activate health data, and creating interventions to prevent and manage disease.

We are uniting different disciplines across life sciences and data technology because we believe it will take an expert cross-functional team to develop the next generation of health solutions. Our diverse team pushes one another as well as our collaborators to think beyond today’s assumptions and operate from a shared vision of what healthcare should be. It’s amazing what’s possible when we put our heads together.

item.title: Hardware Developer, Optical Testing, Augmented Reality
item.description:
2022-09-01T21:30:47.130Z

Hardware Developer, Optical Testing, Augmented Reality

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Physics, Optics, Material Science Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience working in a test/metrology/inspection environment characterizing and evaluating optical components and coatings using standard optical metrology techniques.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Optics, Material Science Engineering, or equivalent.
  • 1 year of experience working in a complex, matrixed organization.
  • Experience working closely with suppliers developing optical components and coatings.
  • Experience using data analysis tools or coding language (Python or MATLAB) for data acquisition and analysis.
  • Knowledge of various coating processes/technologies and materials (dip, PVD, lamination).
  • Industry knowledge of optics and coating reliability issues, technical trade offs between materials, cost, manufacturability, market, and technology trends.

About the job

In this role, you will be working closely with other groups (e.g., Manufacturing, Developing, Quality, Reliability, Supply Chain, etc.) to inspect and characterize prototype and production components for a novel consumer electronics product.

The Google Augmented Reality team is a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and building helpful, delightful user experiences. We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Develop test processes, First Article Inspection plans to characterize and verify optical coatings, and components for functional performance and reliability.
  • Define and specify equipment and custom fixtures to enable the verification of optical coatings for various use cases in different environments. 
  • Conduct inspection and testing of optical coatings and components.
  • Analyze and document results of testing to share/present to Developer and Manufacturing teams.
  • Support the development of Design of Experiment to isolate critical parameters for developer analysis.

We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Develop test processes, First Article Inspection plans to characterize and verify optical coatings, and components for functional performance and reliability.
  • Define and specify equipment and custom fixtures to enable the verification of optical coatings for various use cases in different environments. 
  • Conduct inspection and testing of optical coatings and components.
  • Analyze and document results of testing to share/present to Developer and Manufacturing teams.
  • Support the development of Design of Experiment to isolate critical parameters for developer analysis.

item.title: Staff Software Developer, Android, Wear OS
item.description:
2022-04-14T03:31:51.951Z

Staff Software Developer, Android, Wear OS

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in software development and with data structures/algorithms.
  • 5 years of experience testing and launching software products.
  • 3 years of experience with software design and architecture.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master’s degree or PhD in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field.
  • 5 years of experience with Android application development.
  • 5 years of experience with performance, large systems data analysis, visualization tools, and/or debugging.
  • 3 years of experience in a technical leadership role leading project teams and setting technical direction.
  • 3 years of experience working in a complex matrixed organization, involving cross-functional and/or cross-business projects.

About the job

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We\'re looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Our team\'s focus is on providing seamless connectivity whether they are near their phone or on Wifi/LTE and deliver key experiences for the user.

We work with external carriers, device partners, and the Global System for Multiple Applications (GSMA) to define and build the standards around provision and integration of eSIM devices with mobile operators. Our goal is to release hardware to deliver polished, powerful wearable experiences to users, and also enable a thriving open-market ecosystem of cellular-enabled devices.

Google is a software development company at heart. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology\'s greatest challenges and make an impact on users around the world. At Google, software developers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, social to local, Google software developers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

Responsibilities

  • Build and lead a team of Devlopers to build the next-generation connectivity platform for cellular-enabled smartwatches.
  • Design and build eSIM provision experience for smartwatches.
  • Design and build untethered experiences on smartwatches.
  • Work with external carrier and device partners, to standardize and integrate the Wear OS eSIM solution with mobile operators across the world.
  • Be able to contribute to emerging mobile standards on eSIM provision for all open-market devices and services.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.

item.title: Supportability Program Manager, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-02-07T22:01:53.791Z

Supportability Program Manager, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Waterloo, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience in program management, leading technical projects.
  • Experience with data visualization, SQL, and building dashboards.
  • Experience with software/cloud platforms and technologies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA or graduate degree in a management field, with an emphasis on business operations and strategy.
  • Experience with Customer Support operations.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, impeccable business judgment, and knowledge of customer support principles.
  • Ability to communicate with and influence diverse technical and non-technical groups, spanning all organizational levels.
  • Firm sense of accountability, and ability to take ownership in an environment that requires navigating ambiguity.
  • Solid organizational, project management, and written and verbal communication skills.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Supportability Program Manager, you’ll work with teams across Google to improve our customers’ experience and make our products better. You’ll advocate to leadership for engineering and tooling improvements that elevate the customer experience. You’ll aggregate data and qualitative inputs, and provide analytical insights that represent a non-biased perspective of customers using GCP. You’ll identify requirements, organize project schedules, and identify risks to integrate support for new products and services. As a Program Manager, you will structure, lead and execute exciting, complex, and cross functional programs using your operational, data analysis and program management expertise. You will work to drive alignment and collaboration on the execution and achievement of key business goals. You will plan requirements with internal stakeholders and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Lead programs to improve the customers’ product and support experience and reduce their need for support; develop project schedules, milestones and risk analysis/mitigation.
  • Develop project schedules, milestones, stakeholder dependencies, and risk analysis/mitigation to meet supportability objectives, including tooling and process requirements. Coordinate and influence across stakeholders to see those projects through implementation.
  • Apply analytics to evaluate and develop recommendations; define, articulate and advise on product requirements.
  • Work with engineers and product managers to pursue agreed upon objectives while tracking, prioritizing and communicating top issues.
  • Develop effective partnerships with multiple stakeholders to deliver insights and drive improvements across Support and Product Engineering teams.

Information collected and processed as part of your Google Careers profile, and any job applications you choose to submit is subject to Google\'s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google\'s EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

To learn more about COVID vaccination requirements for US Google workplaces, read our Vaccination Entry Policy.

At Google, we’re committed to building a workforce that is more representative of the users we serve and creating a culture where everyone feels like they belong. To learn more about our diversity, equity, inclusion commitments and how we’re building belonging, please visit our Belonging page for more information.

We welcome and encourage people who are expecting and/or parents-to-be to apply to this or any other role at Google.

Google is a global company and, in order to facilitate efficient collaboration and communication globally, English proficiency is a requirement for all roles.
